Hildebrando, 59, is a father living with his wife and children in Cayaltí, an agricultural district located over an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last ten years he has raised small farm animals.   He raises them in his yard feeding them grains and natural grasses.  When they reach a good level of development he sells them to merchants who frequent the area.  He uses income from this activity as an important source of family support.

Hildebrando wants to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them to increase his sales and profits so he is asking for his first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

His greatest wish is to continue to grow as a businessman and to be able to provide his family with a better quality of life.  People who know him consider him to be levelheaded and trustworthy.

loans.use: To buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them to increase sales.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
Rosario es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a tres hijos en edad escolar en el caserío Annape Barrio San Antonio, una zona rural que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Mórrope, provincia de Lambayeque. El lugar se encuentra ubicado a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde a la crianza y venta de animales menores como ganado ovino y caprino. El los cría en algunos ambientes de su domicilio alimentándolos de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. El  utiliza los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad como una fuente importante de ingresos para sostener la economía de su familia.

Rosario desea realizar algunas mejoras en su domicilio, específicamente desea enlucir el interior de su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles con los cuales planea adquirir el material que necesita para lograr su objetivo.

Rosario es alguien bastante trabajador y entregado a su familia, las personas que le conocen le consideran un hombre tranquilo y honrado.
texts.en:
Rosario is a 32 year old father who resides with his wife and three school-age children in the village of Annape Barrio San Antonio, a rural area situated in the District of Mórrope, Province of Lambayeque. This place is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Rosario raises and sells small animals, such as sheep and goats, from home and feeds them grain and natural grasses. Once they have reached the proper stage of development, the animals are sold to merchants who visit the area. The earnings he generates from this activity provide an important source of income to maintain the family finances.

Rosario wants to make some improvements to his home, specifically plaster the interior walls of his house. He is requesting his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN so that he can acquire the materials needed to accomplish his goal.

Rosario is a hard worker who is devoted to his family. The people who know him consider him to be a peaceful and honest man.

loans.use: Purchase materials to plaster the interior walls of his house

loans.name: Blanca Ysolina

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a mas de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año aproximadamente a la venta de frutas en un puesto ubicado en el interior del mercado de su localidad. El negocio nació de la idea de obtener una fuente estable de ingresos con los cuales sustentar sus gastos personales y ayudar al sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a que el mercado donde expende sus productos es frecuentado por los pobladores de la zonas rurales del distrito.

Blanca desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda ampliar sus ventas y percibir un mayor numero de ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.

Blanca es una joven alegre y de trato amable. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y poder ampliar su puesto poco a poco.
texts.en:
Blanca, 28, is single and lives with her family in Mochumí district, a farming area belonging to Lambayeque province, located over half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

For about a year she has been selling fruit in a stand in her local market.  The business idea arose because she wanted to have a stable source of income both for her personal expenses and to help with family support.  The business is well received because the market where she sells her products is frequented by people living in the rural areas of the district.

Blanca wants to expand her business buying more products so that sales and profits will increase.  Thus she has deemed it advisable to request her first, 2000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Blanca is a cheerful young woman with a kind attitude.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to gradually enlarge her sales stand.

loans.use: To buy more stock merchandise.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a sus padres en el caserío Insculas del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos de plástico para el hogar como tinas, jarras, vasos y colgadores, para ello cuenta con un pequeño establecimiento situado en un ambiente de su domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de cosméticos via catálogo. Con los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades ella se encarga de solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento de la economía familiar.

Maribel desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de plásticos de modo que pueda ampliar su negocio y percibir mas ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Ella es una joven bastante tranquila y responsable. Su anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maribel, 21, is single and lives with her parents in Insculas, Olmos district, an agricultural area with moderate commercial activity, located over two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells plastic items for the home like: tubs, jars, drinking glasses and hangers.  She has a small sales area set up in her home.  She also sells catalogue cosmetics.  Income from these activities allows her to meet personal expenses and help her parents support the family.

Maribel wants to expand her business buying more plastic items to earn more income through sales.  She has, therefore, requested her first, 1000 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

She is a levelheaded, responsible young woman.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to be able to improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more plastic items.

loans.name: Maria Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 41 years old. She lives with her husband and their three children. It is a stable home of hardworking parents. They live in the Valle de los Incas in the district of Tambogrande in the province of Piura, which is a rural zone on the costal plain in the northern part of Peru.

Celia operates a small restaurant and bar, called a picanteria, which is located in the front of her home. It is open Thursday – Monday. Celia sells various local dishes, primarily fish dishes, along with the necessary beverages. The combination of ceviche (fresh fish with red onion and lime juice) and one of the local beers is a very popular dish in the region, and one that earns her many loyal customers.

Celia’s husband is a farm worker who manages a small plot of land on which the family grows lemons and mangos.

This is Celia’s first loan with our institution. She plans to use the proceeds to expand her offerings of beverages and food. She hopes this will allow her to increase her profits and expand her market share.

loans.use: Expand her offerings of beverages and food within her restaurant

loans.name: Vilma Emelina

texts.es:
Vilma Emelina B. Núñez es una ama de casa y comerciante de 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene seis hijos y reside en la Aldea La Puerta en la Comunidad de Lepaguare, Olancho. 
Inició a ganarse la vida vendiendo cosméticos, ahora ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano para camas y niños, aprendió su negocio después de observar que algunas de sus vecinas vendían ropa y les iba bien, entonces compró un fardo y obtuvo muy buenas ganancias y además le quedaron algunas piezas para uso personal. No tiene un horario de atención establecido ya que los clientes pueden ir a buscarla a su casa y también sale a vender cuando termina los quehaceres de su hogar. Una de las ventajas que tiene es que con las ganancias puede apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y una de sus dificultades es que como vende de forma ambulante está expuesta a cualquier cambio de clima. 
Con el préstamo solicitado comprará tres fardos de ropa de segunda mano y con eso su negocio estará mejor surtido y con las ganancias obtenidas no la faltaría el sustento diario a su familia. Su sueño es instalar una pulpería para tener otra entrada de dinero y  de esta manera obtener más ganancias para poder seguir dándole el estudio a su hija menor.
texts.en:
Vilma is a housewife and trader. She is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children. She lives in the hamlet of La Puerta in the Lepaguare community in Olancho.
She started out earning a living selling cosmetics, but now she sells second hand clothes for kids and bedding. She had the idea to start this business after seeing some of her neighbors selling clothes and doing well from it. So, she bought a bundle of clothes and got very good returns and also was able to keep some items for her own use. She does not have set work hours, but her customers can come and find her in her house and she also goes around the community making sales when she has finished the daily housework. One of the advantages of this work is that the income enables her to help her husband with the household expenses. One of the drawbacks is that, as she sells her goods in the street, she is exposed to all types of weather. 
She will use this loan to buy three bundles of second-hand clothing and this will leave her business better supplied. The resulting income will enable her to keep supporting the daily needs of her family. Her dream is to open a store so she can have another source of income to support her youngest daughter's studies.

loans.use: To buy bundles of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Liliana

texts.en:
Lilliana is 32 years old. She lives with her husband and their five children in Tambogrande in the province of Piura. This is a rural zone where farmers try to squeeze a living out of the desert valleys through the skillful use of irrigation systems.

The family raises animals and manages a small farm. Lilliana manages their herd of sheep which she raises near their home. Her husband takes care of the small plot of land that they inherited from their parents. On this plot, they grow lemons and mangos.  Her husband also works as a laborer on other farms when he isn’t working on their property.

Lilliana will use the loan to purchase animal feed in bulk to ensure that her animals continue to grow and reach the appropriate size and weight for sale at the maximum price. She also plans to expand the herd. They hope to be able to continue growing their business so they can better provide for their children.

loans.use: Purchase additional animals and feed

loans.name: Mecedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is nineteen years old.  She lives with her family in Tambogrande a town in the northern part of Peru in the province of Piura.  It is a primarily rural zone which consists of farmers squeezing a living out of the desert valleys through skillful use of irrigation systems.

On Saturdays, Sundays and Mondays, Mercedes sells food and beverages out of her home.  She sells food, chicha (a traditional beverage which is brewed from corn) and beer.  This business is growing steadily given her hours of attention and the demand in the area.

She plans to use the loan proceeds to expand her inventory and make purchases at bulk prices.  She expects that this will allow her to expand market share and also increase her profit margin.  She hopes to one day expand her business to become a distributor.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan is forty-five years old.  He lives with his wife and their five children in their own home in Tambogrande in the province of Piura.  Tambogrande is a primarily rural zone which consists of farmers squeezing a living out of the desert valleys through skillful use of irrigation systems.

The family raises animals and manages a small farm.  They own a number of sheep and pigs which they maintain in corrals near their home.  Juan also owns a small plot of land which he inherited from family.  He cares for the trees on the property, harvesting lemons and mangoes.

This is Juan´s first loan with our institution.  He plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase additional feed in bulk in order to ensure that their animals continue to grow and reach the appropriate size and weight for sale at the maximum price.  Juan hopes that the loan will assist his family in expanding their business and improving their life style.

loans.use: Purchase additional animals and feed

loans.name: Dialis Ines

texts.es:
La Señora Dialis A. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes, su centro histórico  que fue proclamado el primero de diciembre como patrimonio de la humanidad.

Nuestra socia es  de la provincia de Esmeraldas y hace 16 años ha migrado a nuestra ciudad motivada por su hermana y en busca de un mejor trabajo. Tiene 42 años, es soltera y tiene una hija de 14 años de edad que estudia  en el colegio. No tiene vivienda propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña Dailis trabaja como conserje de una universidad  hace un año y medio de lunes a viernes y un sábado al mes, también tiene un negocio de venta de comida hace 5 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 8 de la noche.
 
Se encuentra en su cuarto crédito, fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa de la banca comunal. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la preparación de sus platos.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Dialis A. is a member of the Renacer Uncovia Communal Bank, she lives around the Uncovia area in the city of Cuenca, a city known for its beautiful landscapes, and its historic center was declared December 1st as a world heritage site.

Our member is from the Esmeralda’s province and 16 years ago she migrated to our city, motivated by her sister in search of a better job. Dialis is 42 years old, is single and has a 14 year old daughter who attends high school. Dialis does not own a home which is why she rents.

Mrs. Dialis has worked as a custodian in the University for a year and a half from Monday to Friday and one Saturday a month. She also has a business selling food, which she has had for 5 years and works in it Sunday to Sunday from 3 p.m. until 8 p.m.

This is Diali’s fourth loan, she was invited to be a member of the communal bank by a friend who is an active member. Diali’s loan is to buy foodstuffs to make her dishes.

Dialis’ goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Mariana Ines

texts.es:
La Señora Mariana C. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector de Uncovia en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes, su centro histórico  que fue proclamado el primero de diciembre como patrimonio de la humanidad.
 
Doña Mariana se dedica al comercio de cosméticos en especial de la marca de Yanbal, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 4 años, sus productos los vende de lunes a viernes en el tiempo libre que tiene, que es cuando sus hijos están estudiando.
 
La Señora Mariana tiene de 36 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 17 y 8 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en la escuela, su esposo trabaja como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendado.

Se encuentran en su cuarto ciclo y los créditos anteriores le han beneficiado para crecer en su negocio. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más cosméticos como perfumes, cremas, etc.
 
Su meta es seguir trabajando para poder comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana C. is a member of the Renacer Uncovia Communal Bank, she lives around the Uncovia area in the city of Cuenca, a city known for its beautiful landscapes, and its historic center was declared December 1st as a world heritage site.

Mrs. Mariana sells makeup especially Yanbal brand, work that she has being doing for some 4 years, she sells the products Monday through Friday in the spare time that she has, which is when her children are in school.

Mrs. Mariana is 36 years old, is married and has 2 children who are 17 and 8 years old, her first son is in high school and the second is in elementary school, her husband works as a private employee, they don’t have their own home which is why they rent.

This is Mrs. Mariana’s fourth loan and the previous loans have helped her grow her business. The new loan is to buy more makeup and items like perfumes, creams, etc.

Mariana’s goal is to keep working to buy her own home.

loans.use: To buy creams, perfumes, and makeup.

loans.name: María Socorro

texts.es:
La Señora María C. es socia del banco comunal Renacer Uncovia, vive por el sector de María Auxiliadora en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por sus bellos paisajes, su centro histórico el que fue proclamado el primero de diciembre como patrimonio de la humanidad.
 
Doña María tiene de 31 años, está divorciada hace un año,  tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 6 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora María es de profesión costurera, actividad que la viene realizando hace varios años, cuenta con un negocio propio y labora de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.  Todo lo que sabe lo  aprendió por habilidad y se dedica a la reparación de todo tipo de prendas de vestir, también elabora forros para muebles de sala y teje chompas, bufandas, etc.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito y ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las compañeras de la banca comunal. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela, hilo, etc.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa y obtener su licencia de conducir.
texts.en:
Mrs. María C. is a member of the Renacer Uncovia Communal Bank, she lives around the Uncovia area in the city of Cuenca, a city known for its beautiful landscapes, and its historic center was declared December 1st as a world heritage site.

Mrs. María is 31 years old, she has been divorced for a year and has 3 children of 11, 9 and 6 years of age. All of her children are in school in the city. María doesn’t own a home and which is why she rents.

Mrs. María is a seamstress, work that she had done for some years and she has her own business. She works from Sunday to Sunday without a set schedule. She has learned everything by skill and mends all types of clothing, she also makes sofa covers and knits sweaters, scarves, etc.

This is María’s second loan and she has a good friendship with all the members of the communal bank. María’s new loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, etc.

María’s goal is to have her own home and to have her driver’s license.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María G. es socia del banco comunal Damas del Futuro, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus bellos paisajes y su naturaleza, es la tercera ciudad  más importante del país.
 
Doña María tiene 57 años, es viuda hace 10 años, tiene 7 hijos que son mayores de edad, sus cinco hijos están casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, con su trabajo y esfuerzo ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
La Señora. María es comerciante, vende todo tipo de ropa, actividad que lo realiza hace muchos años, ella vende recorriendo el campo, labora todos los días menos los días miércoles.
 
Se encuentra en su octavo ciclo, en este tiempo ha llegado a tener una gran amistad con todas las socias de la banca comunal, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su mercadería.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María G. is a member of the Damas del Futuro Communal Bank, she lives in Cuenca city, this city is known for its architectural beauty, its beautiful landscapes and flora and fauna, and it is the third most important city of the country.

Mrs. María is 57 years old, she has been a widow for 10 years, she has 7 children who are grown up, five of them are married and live independently, the other two are single, work and help María economically. Through hard work, María was able to build her own home.

Mrs. María is a merchant and sells all types of clothing, a job that she has done for many years, she sells her items by going to the countryside, she works everyday except Wednesdays.

This will be María’s eight loan, and she has been able to have great friendships will the other members of the communal bank. María’s new loan will be used to buy more clothing to stock her shop.

María’s goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Ana Lucía

texts.es:
La Señora Ana P. es socia del banco comunal Damas del Futuro vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza arquitectónica, sus bellos paisajes y su naturaleza, es tercera ciudad  más importante económicamente del país.
 
La Señora. Ana se encuentra en su octavo ciclo en la banca comunal, ha llegado a conformar grandes lasos de amistad con todas las compañeras de la banca.
 
Nuestra socia es comerciante de ropa desde hace mucho tiempo, labora de domingo a domingo excepto los días miércoles que es cuando va a comprar  más mercadería para la venta, no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y labora recorriendo por las zonas rurales de la ciudad de Cuenca.
 
Doña Ana tiene 35 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 18 años de edad que trabaja y ayuda  en los gastos del hogar, su esposo es comerciante se dedica a  la venta de ropa, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su hermano.
 
Con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para surtir más su mercadería.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana P. is a member of the Damas del Futuro Communal Bank, she lives in Cuenca city, this city is known for its architectural beauty, its beautiful landscapes and flora and fauna, and it is the third most important financial center of the country.

This is Mrs. Ana’s eight loan with the communal bank and she has formed great friendships with other members of the communal bank.

Our member is a merchant, she has sold clothing for some time, she works Sunday to Sunday except Wednesdays when she goes to buy more merchandize, she doesn’t have a work schedule and works traveling through rural areas of the city of Cuenca.

Mrs. Ana is 35 years old, is married and has an 18 year old son that works and helps her with the household expenses, her husband sells clothing. They don’t own a home which is why they live in Ana’s brother’s home.

With the new loan, Ana will buy more items to stock her store.

Ana’s goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
La Señora María S. es socia del banco comunal Damas del Futuro, vive por la parroquia de Quita Chica, parroquia en donde su gente se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales, mucha de su población encuentra en la ciudad mejores oportunidades de trabajo logrando mejorar la economía de sus hogares.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 26, 20 y 19 años de edad, su primera hija es economista trabaja y es independiente, su segunda y tercera hija  estudian en la universidad, su esposo tiene su taxi en el que labora todos los días, tienen casa propia que es fruto del trabajo de los dos.
 
Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar en donde también trabaja en una tienda la cual ya tiene 16 años, labora todos los días de domingo a domingo, abre su local desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche.
 
Doña María ha sido nuestra socia anteriormente pero ahora se encuentra reingresando de nuevo a la banca comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su tienda como son aceites, fideos, arroz, etc.

Su meta es no tener más deudas.
texts.en:
Mrs. María S. is a member of the Damas del Futuro Communal Bank, she lives around the Quita Chica area, where the majority of the people are in agriculture and breed animals, much of the populace find that the city has better employment opportunities that help them improve their homes’ finances.

Our member is 56 years old, is married and has 3 children of 26, 20 and 19 years of age. Her first daughter is an economist, works and is independent, her second and third daughters are attending university, her husband has a taxi where he works everyday, and they have their own home which is a result of the hard work of both.

Mrs. María is a housewife and she also works in a store in her home, she has had it for 16 years and works everyday from Sunday to Sunday and opens her store at 6 in the morning and closes at 11 at night. Mrs. María was a member of the communal bank before and has rejoined recently, the money from the loan will be used to buy products for her store like oils, spaghettis, rice, etc.

María’s goal is to not have any debt.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, eggs, and foodstuffs in general.

loans.name: Mariana De Jesus

texts.es:
La Señora Mariana M. es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como unas de las mas bellas del Ecuador por su cultura y tradición, cuenta con una gastronomía muy variada, su gente es amable y cordial.

Nuestra socia tiene 22 años, es viuda hace un año, tiene  4 hijos de 6, 5, 3 años  y  un bebe de 5 meses, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, no tiene  casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora Mariana se dedica a la venta  de frutas en un mercado de la ciudad, actividad que la viene realizando hace dos años, labora todos los días sin descansar uno solo desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las siete y media de la noche.

Doña Mariana se encuentra en su segundo ciclo en  la banca comunal y poco a poco va teniendo una muy buena amistad con todas las socias, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas para seguir creciendo en su negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mariana M. is a member of the La Paz Communal Bank, she lives in the city of Cuenca, which is considered one of the most beautiful places in Ecuador for its culture and traditions, it has great varied food and its people are very friendly and cordial.

Our member is 22 years old, has been widowed for a year and has 4 children of 6, 5, and 3 years of age and a 5 month old baby, her two eldest children go to a school in the city, Mariana doesn’t own a home which is why she rents.

Mrs. Mariana sells fruits in a market in the city, work that she has done for 2 years, she works everyday without rest from 9 in the morning until seven thirty in the evening.

This will be Mrs. Mariana’s second loan with the communal bank and little by little she has been creating good friendships with the other members. The loan will be used to buy fruits to keep her business growing.

Mariana’s goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy plantains, coconuts, pineapples, papayas and fruits in general.

loans.name: Narcisa De Jesus

texts.es:
La Señora Narcisa C. es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como unas de las más bellas del Ecuador por su cultura y tradición, cuenta con una gastronomía muy variada, su gente es amable y cordial. 

Doña Narcisa tiene 47 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 27, 25 y 14 años de edad, su primera hija es casada, vive con ella y comparten los gastos del hogar, su segundo hijo trabaja y ayuda en la economía del hogar y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. También tiene dos nietos los que pasan a su cuidado cuando su hija sale al trabajo. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Narcisa se dedica a la venta de ropa usada hace 30 años, vende los días sábados y domingos. Vende también cosméticos Yanbal, esta actividad la viene realizando hace 20 años. Trabaja como empleada domestica tres días a la semana.
 
Es nuestra socia hace varios años en la banca comunal y ha llegado tener una muy buena amistad con cada una de las socias, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más productos para su negocio de cosméticos y ropa.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Narcisa C. is a member of the La Paz Communal Bank, she lives in the city of Cuenca, which is considered one of the most beautiful places in Ecuador for its culture and traditions, it has great varied food and its people are very friendly and cordial.

Mrs. Narcisa is 47 years old, is single and has 3 children of 27, 25 and 14 years of age. Her eldest daughter is married and lives with her and shares in the household expenses, the second son works and helps with the household expenses as well and the youngest son attends high school. She also has two grandchildren which she takes care of when her daughter goes to work. Mrs. Narcisa doesn’t own her home which is why she rents.

Mrs. Narcisa has sold used clothing for some 30 years, she sells Saturdays and Sundays. She also sells Yanbal makeup; she has done this for some 20 years. Mrs. Narcisa also works as a domestic employee three days a week.

Our member has been a part of the communal bank for some years and has great friendships with each of the members. Mrs. Narcisa’s new loan will be used to buy more products for her business to sell makeup and clothing.

Narcisa’s goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy clothing and makeup.

loans.name: María Graciela

texts.es:
La Señora María A. es socia del banco comunal La Paz, vive en la parroquia de Quinta Chica en donde su población se dedica a la cría de animales, mucha de su población emigra a la ciudad o al exterior en busca de un trabajo que les ayude a mejorar la economía de sus hogares.
 
Doña María se encuentra en su segundo crédito en la banca comunal, fue invitada por una amiga a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras. Nuestra socia se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida rápida, actividad que la viene realizando hace 16 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 7 de la noche hasta las 11 de la noche, dedicándose el resto de su tiempo a los quehaceres de su hogar.

La Señora. María tiene 45 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 26, 24, 22 y 17 años de edad, el primero y tercero de sus hijos son casados, su hija casada vive en su casa y comparten gastos, su segundo hijo trabaja y está  ahorrando para sacar su titulo de Ingeniero en Sistemas y su ultimo hijo estudia en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como empleado privado. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar que le ha prestado.

El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de papas, tarinas, pan, etc. para elaborar su comida rápida.
 
Su meta es comprarse un vehículo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María A. is a member of the La Paz Communal Bank; she lives in the Quinta Chica area where most of the people breed animals. Most of the population emigrates to the city or abroad to find work so that they can improve their household income.

This is Mrs. María’s second loan in the communal bank, she was invited to be a part of it by a friend, and they are a group of hardworking women. Our member works making fast food, work that she has been doing for some 16 years, she works from Monday to Saturday from 7 p.m. until 11 p.m. the rest of the time she dedicates to housework.

Mrs. María is 45 years old, is married and has 4 children of 26, 24, 22 and 17 years of age. The first and third of her children are married, her married daughter lives with her and they share in the household expenses and the second son works and is saving up to have his Computer Science degree, her youngest son is attending high school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee. They don’t own their home and live in a house that a relative loaned them.

The money from the loan will be used to buy potatoes, tarinas (middle-sized plate for meat), bread, etc. to make her fast food.

María’s goal is to buy a car.

loans.use: To buy bread, potatoes, meat, tarinas, etc.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora María P. es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso, vive en la comunidad de la Confianza en la parroquia de Cumbe, En su entorno se encuentran, entre grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas. El centro parroquial de Cumbe está organizado en torno a la plaza central y se caracteriza por conservar parte de su arquitectura tradicional, la cual se ve reflejada en las casas de dos plantas, su gente se dedica agricultura y ganadería.

Doña María tiene de 54 años, es viuda hace 24 años, tiene 3 hijos que son mayores y viven  independientes.  De su segundo compromiso tiene 7 hijos, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus 5 hijos solteros trabajan y ayudan a la economía de la casa. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.
 
La Señora María se dedica a la cría de gallinas, cuyes y cerdos a los que los vende en su propia comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura, lo que cultiva es para su consumo y solo una mínima parte es para la venta.

Es nuestra socia fundadora de la banca comunal y los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de unos cerdos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es tener más animales
texts.en:
Mrs. María P. is a member of the “El Paraíso” (Paradise) communal bank.  She lives in the community of Confianza, Cumbe parish.  One can find large pasture areas of cattle ranches and romantic old haciendas in her surroundings.  The Cumbe parish center is arranged around a central plaza noted for conserving its traditional architecture which is reflected in the two story houses.  Most of the residents are farmers and cattlemen.

María, 54, was widowed 24 years ago.  She has three adult children who live independently.  From her second marriage she has 7 children, the two oldest are married and live independently and the five single children work and contribute to household expenses.  Through her work she has managed to build her house.  Her second husband is a farmer.

María raises chickens, guinea pigs and pigs for later sale in her own community.  She is also a farmer.  Most of what she grows is for her own consumption; just a very small part of it is sold.

She is the founding member of the communal bank and the loans have benefited her business.  The new loan will be used to buy pigs and feed for them.

Her goal is to have more animals.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Grima Liduvina

texts.es:
La Señora. Grima P. es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso, vive en la comunidad de la Floresta en la parroquia de Cumbe, En su entorno se encuentran, entre grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas. El centro parroquial de Cumbe está organizado en torno a la plaza central y se caracteriza por conservar parte de su arquitectura tradicional, la cual se ve reflejada en las casas de dos plantas, su gente se dedica agricultura y ganadería.

Nuestra socia tiene  37 años, vive en unión libre y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 2 años de edad. Se dedica a la costura, aprendió este oficio en una academia, estudio por dos años y poco a poco ha ido perfeccionando sus conocimientos y ahora cuanta con su propio taller, elabora todo tipo de prendas de vestir, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin tener un horario fijo. Su esposo se dedica al área de la construcción. No tienen casa propia.
 
Doña Grima se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 4 años y todos los créditos le han beneficiado en su hogar y principalmente en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va invertir en la compra de tela para seguir en la elaboración de sus prendas.
 
Su meta es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Grima P. is a member of the El Paraíso Communal Bank; she lives in the Floresta community in the Cumbe area. The place has great fields of cattle ranches, and romantic old haciendas. The central area of Cumbe is organized by the central place that is distinguished because it preserved its traditional architecture, which is reflected in the two story buildings. Most of the townspeople work in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Our member is 37 years old, she lives in a common law marriage and has 2 children of 4 and 2 years of age. She is a seamstress and learned her trade in an academy; she went to school for two years and little by little she has been improving her trade. Mrs. Grima has her own workshop where she makes all types of clothing and she works from Monday to Saturday without a set schedule. Her husband works in construction. They don’t own a home.

Mrs. Grima has been a part of the communal bank for 4 years and all the loans have helped her home and mainly her business, the new loan will be used to buy fabric to keep making her clothing.

Grima’s goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Elsa Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Elsa C. es socia del banco comunal El Paraíso, vive en la comunidad de la Floresta en la parroquia de Cumbe, En su entorno se encuentran, entre grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, románticas haciendas viejas. El centro parroquial de Cumbe está organizado en torno a la plaza central y se caracteriza por conservar parte de su arquitectura tradicional, la cual se ve reflejada en las casas de dos plantas, su gente se dedica agricultura y ganadería.

Doña Elsa tiene 24 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijo de 8  y 5 años de edad que estudian en la escuela. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción laborando como albañil. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos.

La Señora. Elsa se dedica a trabajar en la costura, actividad que la viene desempeñando hace 6 años,  todo lo que sabe lo aprendió en el colegio, realiza todo tipo de arreglo a las prendas de vestir y también se dedica a la elaboración de pantalones.

Se encuentra en su quinto ciclo en la banca comunal, tiempo en el cual ha llegado a tener una muy buena amistad con todas las socias, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para la confección de los pantalones.
 
Su meta es llegar a tener un taller de confección de ropa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa C. is a member of the El Paraíso Communal Bank; she lives in the Floresta community in the Cumbe area. The place has great fields of cattle ranches, and romantic old haciendas. The central area of Cumbe is organized by the central place that is distinctive because it preserved its traditional architecture, reflected in the two story buildings. Most of the people in the area work in agriculture and livestock breeding.

Mrs. Elsa is 24 years old, is married and has 2 children who are 8 and 5 years old, they attend school. Her husband works in construction as a mason. They don’t own a home which is why they live with her mother and share in the household expenses.

Mrs. Elsa works as a seamstress, she has worked for 6 years in this field and all that she knows she learned in school. She makes all types of clothing and also makes pants.

This is Mrs. Elsa’s fifth loan with the communal bank, and during this time she has grown to have good friendships with all of the members. The new loan will be used to buy fabric to make pants.

Elsa’s dream is to have her own workshop to make her clothing.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en:
Malek is a father of three sons who are under 18. Malek started a small poultry farm five years ago; he raises chickens to be sold to poultry shops in the city of Nablus, where he lives.

Malek wants to expand his project to accommodate the growing size of the current farm. Malek has gained good experience from five years of taking care of his own farm and would like to invest this experience in a better and more modern farm. Malek came to FATEN for a $1,000 loan to improve his farm and build better coops.

In the picture, Malek stands in his farm surrounded by the chickens.

loans.use: To improve his poultry farm and build better chicken coops

loans.name: Vadar

texts.en:
Vadar B. is a farmer devoted both to his work and to being a father. He is married and has two sons.

He works hard in raising his cattle, taking them out to graze in the early mornings. Raising cattle is not an easy task, but his love for his family gives his work reason and meaning. Currently, Vadar wants to improve his situation by increasing his number of cattle which in the long run will provide better income. He applied for 1000 AZN loan to purchase three calves.

loans.use: purchase three calves

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is a father of four sons and three daughters. He started a small store, selling and fixing computers. Jamal has very good experience in this field, which he has been working in for years.

Jamal wants to improve his store and increase the number of his clients. He took a $1,000 loan from FATEN to purchase the repair tools he needs.  The store is the only source of income for Jamal's family. 

Jamal appears here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase computer repair tools

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 24-year-old single man who supports his family, including 5 siblings and 2 parents. He borrowed $2000 to improve his existing barbershop, which was established in 2008.  What distinguishes his barbershop is that it is the only barbershop in his area.

loans.use: To improve his barbershop

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase wood

loans.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa J. is a 35 year old married lady with five children. She sells charcoal to residents of Barani in Malindi town where she resides. Asmaa has been operating the business for two years now she wishes to expand it with the loan she has taken.

This is the fourth time that Asmaa is taking a loan from KADET LTD. The loan amounts to Kshs.30,000 and the she intends to add more stock to her business as well as repair the business premises so as to propagate growth of the business. By growing the business, Asmaa will be able to satisfy her customers who are mostly from the local area and will also be able to look after her family.

Asmaa hopes to eventually own a wholesale charcoal business, selling to hotels around Malindi and to people residing outside the ever busy town.

loans.use: To expand the business by adding more stock of charcoal and repair the business premises

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan est une femme de 45 ans, son mari est   directeur d’école. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits cosmétiques. Elle a une expérience de  3 ans dans ce commerce. Le crédit  qu’elle sollicite va lui permettre d’accroître son stock avec divers produits cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Massan is a 45 year old woman. Her husband is a school headmaster. She earns a living by selling cosmetics. She has 3 years’ experience in this business. 

The loan she is requesting will enable her to increase her stock with various cosmetic products.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Kanko

texts.fr: Kanko est  une femme  de 32 ans, elle a appris le métier de la coiffure. A la fin de son apprentissage elle a ouvert son propre atelier  qu’elle a nommé «  AFRO STAR ». Elle vend dans son atelier des mèches, perruques et tissages qu’elle utilise pour  coiffer  ses clientes. Elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour  l’achat de cartons de mèches, tissages et perruques. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en: Kanko is a 32 year-old hairdresser. When her apprenticeship came to an end she opened her own studio which she named 'Afro Star'. She sells streaks of hair, wigs and weaves which she uses to style her customers. She is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase packs of streaks, weaves and wigs. She is married with two children.

loans.use: To purchase streaks of hair and wigs

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab I. is a 30 year old married lady with two children. 

She operates Fried Potatoes in Kenyatta avenue Street in Malindi. The lady was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the company’s clients. She is now getting a third loan for Kshs 15,000, with which she plans to expand her business by buying more stock and venture into selling fresh juice as well. 

Zainab hopes that, by doing this, her business will grow and she will be able to use the anticipated profit to help support her family.  She hopes to someday own a well established restaurant in the area.

loans.use: To buy more stock food items like cooking oil , and venture into selling fresh juice

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla exerce comme activité  génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois. Elle a commencé ce commerce en 1993. Faisant face à une baisse de son stock de marchandises, elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat  de 30 sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport des marchandises. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants.
texts.en: Abla has sold wood coal for a living since 1993.  Her stock levels are falling, so she is seeking a loan from WAGES in order to purchase 30 bags of wood coal and to ensure that her goods are transported safely. She is married with three children.

loans.use: Purchase of bags of wood coal

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi  exerce depuis 3 ans déjà le commerce de céréales, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays, ce qui lui permet de bénéficier d’une plus grande marge bénéficiaire sur ses ventes. Actuellement la demande de sa clientèle est élevée, le stock dont elle dispose ne lui permet pas de satisfaire toute sa clientèle, elle sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit pour l’achat d’une trentaine de sac s de maïs et assurer le transport de la marchandise. Elle est mariée avec une personne à charge.
texts.en: Akouvi has already been in the business of selling cereals for three years.  She gets her supplies  within the country which allows for a greater profit margin on her sales.   Currently, the demand from her clients is up and the stock available to her is not sufficient to satisfy all of them.  Therefore, she is requesting from WAGES her first loan for the purchase of about thirty sacks of corn and to have it transported.  She is married and takes care of one other person.

loans.use: to purchase corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase corn

loans.name: Sitou

texts.fr: sitou est  une femme célibataire très dynamique, pour subvenir à ses propres  besoins elle a commencé l’activité de cambiste c'est-à-dire l’échange de devises. elle souhaite accroître son capital pour gagner plus de revenu elle sollicite donc de WAGES son premier crédit devant lui permettre d’accroître son revenu. Cette activité est très rentable à lomé. elle vend aussi des produits de premières nécessités
texts.en:
Sitou is a very energetic single woman. In order to support herself, she started a foreign currency exchange brokerage business. 

She would like to increase her capital in order to earn more income. She is thus requesting her first loan from WAGES that should allow her to increase her income. This business is very profitable in Lomé. She also sells staple goods.

loans.use: To increase capital

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra est  une femme de 32 ans, elle est mariée avec une personne à sa charge. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de détail de charbons de bois et de maïs. Elle a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé.  sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays dans la localité d’AMOUZOUKONDI.  Elle sollicite de WAGES  un crédit pour acheter 10 sacs de charbons de bois et  5 sacs de maïs.
texts.en: Abra is a 32-year old woman, married with one dependent. She makes a living by retailing charcoal and corn. At present she is running out of stock. She already had a loan from WAGES in the past and repaid it well. Her customer base is very diverse. She stocks up in the interior of the country in the village of Amouzoukondi. She is seeking a loan from wages to purchase 10 bags of charcoal and 5 bags of corn.

loans.use: Purchasing coal, charcoal etc

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: komi est âgé de 31 ans, il est célibataire et habite le quartier d’amadahomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Pour subvenir à ses besoins  il a ouvert une cafétéria qu’il a appelle «  CAFETARIAT WEMBLEY ».  Les produits nécessaires à son activité sont épuisés, il sollicite donc de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 4 cartons d spaghetti, 2 cartons de lait, 2 cartons de sucre, 11 plateaux d’œufs et 8 cartons de tomates.
texts.en: Komi is 31 years old, unmarried and lives in the Amadahomé neighbourhood on the outskirts of Lomé. To support himself, he opened a cafeteria which he called Cafetariat Wembley. He is out of the products that he needs for his business, so he is requesting a WAGES loan to buy 4 boxes of spaghetti, 2 boxes of milk, 2 boxes of sugar, 11 trays of eggs and 8 boxes of tomatoes.

loans.use: Purchase of spaghetti, milk, sugar, eggs and tomatoes

loans.name: Afi Holali

texts.fr: Afi  est une femme de 30 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de sachets en plastique, elle a commencé ce commerce en 2004. Ce commerce marche bien pour elle et sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Actuellement  son stock a considérablement baissé et elle a besoin de s’approvisionner pour satisfaire à bien sa clientèle. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 40 balles  de sachets. Elle est mariée et mère d’un enfant.
texts.en:
Afi  is 30 years old, and earns income by selling plastic bags.  She began this work in 2004 and it is going well for her.  Her clientèle is made up of all different types of people. 

At the moment her stock has gone down and she needs to get more supplies in order to meet her customers' needs. She is asking WAGES for a loan to buy 40 bales of bags.

She is married and the mother of one child.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags

loans.name: Viviane Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme de 38 ans très dynamique. Elle a 2 personnes à charge. Elle est une cliente fidèle de WAGES. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES 3 crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en détail de fournitures scolaires. La rentrée scolaire a commencé au Togo, elle veut accroître son revenu et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour accroître son stock de marchandises avec 10 cartons de cahiers de 300 pages, 5 cartons de cahier de 200 pages, 3 cartons de cahiers de 100 pages. Et divers autres articles scolaires.
texts.en: Afi is a very energetic 38-year old woman. She has two dependents. She is a loyal client of WAGES. She already obtained three loans from WAGES in the past and repaid all of them well. She makes a living by retailing school supplies. As the new school year in Togo has started, she would like to increase her revenues. Therefore she is requesting a loan from WAGES in order to stock up with then boxes of 300-pages notebooks, five boxes of 200-pages notebooks, three boxes of 100-pages notebooks and other miscellaneous school supplies.

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies

loans.name: Eziyya

texts.en:
Eziyya is a 65-year-old woman from Jenin. Her husband owns a blacksmith workshop.  The 15-year-old workshop is the family's source of income. The workshop produces windows, doors, water tanks, etc.

Eziyya came to FATEN and took a $2,000 loan so that her husband could purchase a new lathing machine to replace the old one and increase the productivity of the workshop. 

Eziyya appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To purchase a lathing machine

loans.name: Jabbar

texts.en: Jabbar B. has been engaged in farming and cultivating seasonal fruits and vegetables for three years. The father of two adorable daughters who need to be fed and provided with the necessary education, Jabbar is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to purchase seeds and fertilizer in order to improve his business which, in turn, will benefit his family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Aqshin

texts.en:
Aqshin I. is 24 years old. He is married. Aqshin is hard-working and has fought to provide for his family and his parents. He has great sheep breeding experience because he has observed it since he was a boy.  His monthly income is about 250-300 AZN and he usually sells his sheep to local butchers and traders. 

Over time he has increased his sales and now he needs assistance in investing in his business. The business has been going well and he would like it to continue to grow. Aqshin has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy 30 sheep and lambs.

loans.use: purchase 30 sheep and lambs

loans.name: Balakhan

texts.en: Balakhan H. is 52 years old and married with one son. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs such as candies, cookies, preserved foods, soft drinks, juice, tea, and many other items in the grocery store he built many years ago. Today, Balakhan is requesting a loan of 1000 AZN to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: purchase more goods to increase profit

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur N.  owns a small store where he sells car parts. His business is located close to a car maintenance shop. This gives him an opportunity to have many repeat customers and a stable business. 

Elnur has been in this business for a year. During this time, he has developed a good business network that supplies him with the parts his customers order. Elnur would like to borrow 1000 AZN to purchase spare parts in bulk. He dreams that one day he will be able to build one more shop.

loans.use: purchase spare parts

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
Tofiq B. is 54 years old. He is married with four children. Tofiq has a small café where he sells breakfast, lunch, dinner and tea. Prior to opening his own business, he worked at a restaurant where he learned the ins and outs of the trade.  He started his business seven years ago.

When Tofiq first started his business, he only opened to sell tea. Once his place became more popular, he was able to dedicate his whole time to the business. 

Tofiq wants the loan so he may invest in tables, chairs, and utensils. He is asking for a loan of 1000 AZN. With this money, Tofiq will be able to expand his business, to earn more profit, and in turn improve family living conditions.

loans.use: buy tables, chairs, and utensils

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim B. has dedicated himself to the raising of livestock. He is married and a father with the necessity of supporting his three children. His children help him with the business. Ibrahim is faced with the need to purchase calves. In order to then commercialize the derivative products, the raised animals are sold to farmers who resupply the small farmers with calves. To acquire the animals, Ibrahim got a 1000 AZN loan to purchase them and in this way continue to maintain his dear household.

loans.use: purchase 3 heads of cattle

loans.name: Zivar

texts.en:
Zivar M. started her own business eight years ago because her husband’s salary was not enough to cover their family expenses. She sells confectionery like candies, cookies and pastries in the local market. The income she generates allows Zivar to support her family. 

Zivar dreams of enlarging her store and purchasing more merchandise to satisfy her customers' demand. Today she is requesting 1000 AZN. She is going to spend the loan on purchasing confectionery to enlarge the range of goods she sells. She is planning to spend the income for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: purchasing confectionery to enlarge the range of goods she sells

loans.name: Josesito De Cumbe (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Josesito de Cumbe se encuentra formado por un grupo de 18 mujeres de varias edades, trabajadoras, luchadoras y con un solo propósito que con el trabajo y sacrificio diario que tratan de mejorar la estabilidad económica de sus familias. Viven por diferentes lugares de la parroquia de Cumbe, donde hay grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas y románticas haciendas viejas. El centro parroquial de Cumbe está organizado en torno a la plaza central y se caracteriza por conservar parte de su arquitectura tradicional, la cual se ve reflejada en las casas de dos plantas, su gente se dedica agricultura y ganadería.

La Señora Rosa L. vive en la comunidad de San José en la parroquia de Cumbe, se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias. Se dedica a la cría de ganado, la leche que obtiene de ellas la vende a los carros lecheros. También se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas que es para el consumo de su hogar.
Doña Rosa tiene 70 años, es viuda  hace 25 años, tiene 7 hijos mayores de edad, casados que  viven  independientes. Con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento para su ganado y también en abono para sus potreros. Su sueño es  conservar su salud.

La Señora Nelba C. vive en la comunidad de 3 de Noviembre en la parroquia Cumbe. Nuestra socia tiene 20 años, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad,  no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Nelba se dedica a la cría de  pollos, cuyes y ganado, a los cuales los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica,  la leche que obtiene de su ganado la vende a los carros lecheros. Este es el primer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa del banco comunal, este crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. su meta es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Josesito de Cumbe communal bank is made up of 18 women of different ages. They are hardworking fighters whose only purpose is to work and sacrifice every day to try and imporve their familys'  financial stability.  They live in different areas of the Cumbe parish, where there are large pastures of cattle farms and romantic old haciendas.  The parish center of Cumbe is organized around the central plaza and is characterized by the conservation of its traditional architecture.  This can be seen in the two story houses. The people work in farming and cattle. 

Mrs. Rosa L. lives in the San José community in the Cumbe parish. She is on her third loan from the communal bank and she has a very good friendship with all of the members. She raises cattle and she sells the milk that she obtains from them to the milk trucks. She also is a farmer. She plants vegetables for her home consumption.  

Rosa is 70 years old. She has been a widow for 25 years. She has 7 grown children who are married and live independently. With her work she has been able to build her own house. She will invest her loan in buying feed for her cattle and also fertilizer for her pastures. Her dream is to maintain her health.  

Mrs. Nelba C. lives in 3 de Noviembre community in the Cumbe parish. Our member is 20 years old and a single mother of 2 children, aged 1 and 1 years old.  She doesn't own her own home, so she rents.  Nelba raises chickens, guinea pigs and cattle, which she sells when she needs the money. She sells the milk she gets from the cattle to the milk trucks. This is the first loan she has taken out from the communal bank. She was invited by a friend who is an active member of the communal bank. This loan will be invested in buying chicken and feed. Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy chickens, animal feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Elsa Esperanza

texts.es:
Elsa Esperanza S. Cálix es una comerciante de 40 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijas de 11 y 16 años de edad, y junto a su ellas reside en el Barrio Guanaste en la municipio de San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho. 
Desde hace seis años doña Elsa se dedica a la venta de abarrotería en general, su horario de atención es de 6:00 am a 7:00 pm y mientras ella cuida su negocio sus dos hijas se van a sus centros escolares.  La ventaja de tener su propio negocio es que le ha permitido tener un ingreso económico con el cual ha podido sostener a su pequeña familia y eso es importante para ella porque no tiene la ayuda del padre de sus hijas, también puede realizar los quehaceres del hogar y ayudar a sus hijas a realizar sus tareas. 
Elsa solicita el préstamo porque está realizando unas mejoras en su casa y necesita comprar materiales de construcción para repellar las paredes y echar el piso. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera que su hogar tenga un aspecto más atractivo para sus clientes y que sus hijas se sientan más cómodas. Su meta es trabajar y esforzarse cada día para que sus hijas puedan llegar a la universidad y se hagan profesionales, ya que ella no lo pudo hacer. Es su quinto año en FAMA  y con los financiamientos obtenidos ha podido ir mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elsa is a 40 year old trader who is a single mother of two daughters, aged 11 and 16. They live together in Barrio Guanaste in the municipality of San Francisco de la Paz, Olancho.
For the past 6 years, Elsa has been selling general groceries, and her work hours are 6:00am to 7:00pm. While she runs her business, her two daughters go to school. The advantage of having her own business is that it enables her to have an income to support her small family, which is important because they do not get any help from the father of her daughters. She also does the housework and helps her daughters with their homework.
Elsa is requesting a loan because she has been making some improvements to her house and she needs to buy construction materials to plaster the walls and lay a floor. With the help of the loan, she hopes to make her house more attractive for her customers and more comfortable for her daughters. Her goal is to work and strive every day so that her daughters can go to the university and become professionals, something that was not possible for her. This is her 5th year with FAMA and the loans she has had have enabled he to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Reina De La Paz (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Reina de la Paz esta conformado por 10 mujeres quienes son muy alegres y ven la vida de una forma sencilla, trabajan a diario en busca del sustento de sus familias y están orgullosas con lo que han obtenido hasta ahora. Viven en diferentes parroquias de la ciudad, su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería. Estos campos tienen una vista espectacular de su bella naturaleza, donde se respira paz y tranquilidad.

La Señora María P. vive en la parroquia de Zhidmad. Este es su quinto crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y junto a sus amigas  comparten buenos momentos en cada reunión. Nuestra socia tiene de 32 años, es casada y tiene  4 hijos de 13, 11, 9 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo se dedica a la construcción siendo de profesión albañil, con el trabajo duro de cada día han logrado construir su casa propia. 
Doña María hace 20 años comenzó a trabajar como empleada domestica y lo ejerce hasta el momento, trabaja solo algunos días  sin un horario fijo, los días que tiene libre se dedica a cuidar de sus animales como: cerdos, cuyes, gallinas. Hace un año tiene un kiosco y se da tiempo para atenderlo. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para su kiosco para ofrecer a sus clientes una mejor variedad. Su meta es agrandar su casa.

La Señora Rosa B. vive en la comunidad de San Judas Tadeo que  pertenece a la parroquia del Valle. Nuestra socia se encuentra recuperándose de una operación de cálculos al riñón. Trabaja en varias casas como empleada domestica actividad que la viene desempeñando hace 9 años, labora de lunes a viernes y sale del trabajo cuando termina su tarea. En su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos y cuyes a los cuales los vende en su comunidad o los consume junto a su familia. 
Doña Rosa tiene 51 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 16 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y hace poco y es quien le ha dado su primer nieto, vive en su casa y comparten los gastos del hogar, su segunda hija  estudia diseño grafico en el SECAP (Servicio Ecuatoriano de Capacitación Profesional). Su esposo trabaja como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendado.
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito, fue invitada por una amiga quien es socia activa de la banca comunal, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Reina de la Paz community bank is made up of 10 women who are very happy and see life in a simple way.  They work every day to support their families and they are proud with what they have achieved so far.  They live in different parishes in the town.  The people in their town work in crop and livestock farming.  These fields have a spectacular view of the town's natural beauty where peace and tranquility reign.

Mrs María P. lives in Zhidmad parish.  This is the fifth loan which she has had from the community bank and, together with her friends, they have a good time at each meeting.  She is 32 years old, married and has four children aged 13, 11, 9 and 7.  Her eldest two daughters attend high school and her youngest two children attend the local elementary school.  Her husband is in the building trade.  He is a bricklayer.  With hard work every day, they have managed to build their own home.

María began working as a cleaner 20 years ago and she is still doing this.  She only works some days and without regular hours.  When she has days free, she looks after her animals: pigs, guinea pigs and hens.  She has had a kiosk for one year and she spends time working there.  Her new loan will be used to buy products for her kiosk so that she can offer her customers a better range.  Her goal is to extend her house.

Mrs Rosa B. lives in the community of San Judas Tedeo which belongs to the parish of El Valle.  She is recovering from a kidney stone operation.  She works in a number of houses as a cleaner.  She has been doing this for 9 years, working from Monday to Friday.  She leaves work when she has finished her task.  At home she raises chickens and guinea pigs which she sells in her community or eats with her family.

Rosa is 51 years old.  She is married and has two children aged 18 and 16.  Her elder daughter is married and, not long ago, gave Rosa her first grandchild.  She lives in her house and they share household expenses.  Her younger daughter studies graphic design at SECAP (Ecuadorian Professional Training Service).  Her husband works as a private employee.  They don't have their own home and have to rent.

Rosa is requesting her second loan.  She was invited to join by a friend who is an active member of the community bank.  She will invest her new loan in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed.  Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: To buy provisions / chickens and animal feed

loans.name: La Proyeccion De San Jose Group

texts.es:
“L. PROYECCION D. SAN JOSE”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  11 socios entusiastas y emprendedores, quienes realizan diversas actividades como: producción,  comercio y servicio, ellos vienen trabajando con EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desD. hace 4 años.
Gladis Nora es una socia con una visión del emprendimiento muy positivo que gracias a ello ha podido salir adelante con su familia, tiene 50 años, soltera, y tiene 7 hijos, D. los cuales 3 son menores D. edad.
DesD. hace 4 años se dedica a L. venta D. mantas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado por L. zona, elL. se inicio con pocos materiales y justo su vecina le invito a participar en el grupo, y después con el préstamo completo para L. construcción D. su casita, con el esfuerzo D. su labor ha logrado comprar un moto taxi el cual le ayuda para generar mas ingresos, ya que elL. soL. solventa los gastos D. alimentación, servicios y educación D. sus pequeños hijos. 
El reciente préstamo será destinado para invertir en su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados.
texts.en:
The community bank called "L. Proyeccion D. San Jose" has 11 enthusiastic and entrepreneurial members who carry out various business activities such as: production, traD., and services. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for 4 years.
Gladis Nora is a member with a very positive entrepreneurial vision that has helped her be successful for her family. She is 50 years old, single, and has 7 children, 3 of whom are minors.
For the last 4 years she has been selling blankets. Her business is located in the local area. She began with very few materials and her neighbor invited her to be part of the community bank. She had a loan to build her house then, through hard work, she was able to buy a motorcycle taxi, which helps her to earn more. She is solely responsible for the costs of feeding, caring for, and educating her little children. 
She will use this loan to invest in her business. All our members are grateful for the support offered to them and promise to make their repayments by the agreed deadlines.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Mrs. Susana J., from the village of Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, is 45 years old, married, and has one adult and four school-aged children. To make a living, Susana owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for six months, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In February 2010, Susana joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC, she is now requesting her second loan for 1000 PHP to purchase additional products for her retail store. Susana plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and to save for future emergencies.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital

location.town: Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental, Mind

loans.name: Fely's Group

texts.en:
Fely F., from the village of Embargo, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, is 47 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Fely is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Fely F.’s Group.

To make a living, Fely owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for two years, she earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In April 2010, Fely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting her second loan for 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Fely plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living condition of her family.

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

About Group Loans

In a group loan, each group member receives an individual loan but is part of a group of individuals bound by a group guarantee. Under this arrangement, each member of the group supports one another and is responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.use: Additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:

To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling personal home products to tourists and local community members. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Victoria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.
