loans.name: Munhshur

texts.en: Munhshur D. is a 22 year old young lady who lives with her mother and sister in Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. They live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in their relative's yard. Her mother has been working as a servant in the health organization for many years while her sister currently attends a local school. Muhnshur operates a consumer goods retailing business in a rented stall at the central market of province. She began her business in 2007 with working capital of 400,000 MNT in order to support and improve her family's standard of living. Since then, she has found much success with her new business and her working capital has grown to exceed 1,000,000 MNT today. She would like to grow her business and increase her product line for the future. Moreover she hopes to save money so that her sister can study at university. Munhshur is a modest lady and is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more inventory for her retail trading business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Orhontuul

texts.en: Orhontuul P. is a 31 year old and lives with her husband and two children in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in a rented yard. Her oldest daughter, age 11, attends a secondary school while her husband and son stays at home. They own 50 livestock and her husband goes back and forth between countryside and capital city of province to watch their livestock. Orhontuul operates a consumer goods trading business in her town. She started her business in 2009 by renting a small stall in the Central market to sell a variety of products after living in the countryside as a nomadic lifestyle. At first, the working capital was 1,000,000 MNT but soon grew to over 2,500,000 MNT. She moved to new trade center at where she continue to operate her trading business. She focuses on expanding her business further and sell more variety of products in the future. Orhontuul is a friendly and open minded person. She is requesting a  500,000 MNT loan, which she plans to use with her own cash 1,000,000 to purchase more inventory for the upcoming winter for her growing store.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en: Tsetsegmaa D. is 57 years old and lives with her daughter and granddaughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of  Mongolia. She and her family live in their own apartment. Her grandchild attends college. Tsetsegmaa has been operating a clothing and consumer goods trade business since 1993. She provides a variety of clothes and small items such as shoe polishers, juniper, incense sticks, watch batteries, glue, buttons etc. to satisfy her customer's needs. She is focused on expanding business by exceeding her daily average income at 100,000 MNT in the near future. She is a very honest, modest and responsible person. Tsetsegmaa is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan to purchase women's wool shirts and other consumer goods in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase women's wool shirts

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena P. is a married woman who lives in Lower Brgy. Pandan, Bogo City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: General (Sari-sari) store and Tricycle business. Her husband Artemio P., who is 51 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 5 children who are 15 to 25 years old. Rowena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rowena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 which she intends to use to purchase more stocks for the general store so that she could continue to save up for the education of her children. Rowena P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

texts.en: Ma. Melanie E. is a 44-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 1 business venture: Farming business. She lives in Lower Calasa, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her farming business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,500.  Ma. Melanie is now borrowing PHP 22,000 so that she  can fund the operations of her rice fields. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ma. Melanie aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.  About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.name: Tsevelmaa

texts.en: Tsevelmaa B. is a 40-year-old and lives with her husband and adult daughter in Bayanhongor province in central Mongolia. She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. They own 100 livestock and her husband herds their own cattle in the countryside. Tsevelmaa operates a dairy products business in a rented stall at the central market in her town. She started her business in 2002 after moving from countryside and has made much progress with her business over the years. Today her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT. Tsevelmaa uses her earnings to support her family and she has purchased fence in 2002 and car in 2006 for her family with her business profits. She is planning to expand her business for the future. Tsevelmaa is a friendly and open minded woman. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more dairy products at wholesale price to sell through the tsagaan sar, a Mongolian new year, when the products will be in high demand.

loans.use: To purchase more dairy products for sale

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Keo C., 56, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean Temples. C. produces traditional hummocks to sell, earning an income of USD 2 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of about USD 2 per day. Two of her children are employed, earning an income of about USD 3 each per day to help cover the family expenses. The family has to spend USD 35 on food, USD 3 on electricity supply, and USD 25 on other necessary expenses every month.

C. is now requesting her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia, for USD 1200 to open a beauty salon. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.

loans.name: Vong

texts.en:
Vong M., 57, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. The area is known for pre-Angkorean temples. M. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her husband is a carpenter, earning an income of about USD 8 per day. One of her children is employed, earning an income of about USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses. Every month the family spends USD 20 on food, USD 5 on electricity, and USD 10 on other necessary expenses.  

M. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike for her child to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  

This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng K. is a 46-year-old woman married to a local farmer. The couple has seven children; two of them are employed in different jobs and have formal salaries. They live in Phnom Penh City.

Sreng owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. Sreng and her husband work together in the fields.

Currently, Sreng said her kids always have to travel to work by hiring a taxi or walking because they don't have their own vehicle. To solve the problem, Sreng has requested a loan of $400 to be used to buy a used motorcycle for her kids so they won’t have to spend taxi fare.

Photo: Sochanda is sitting on the motorbike which she wanted to buy because she bought it from her neighbor, but she does not give money yet. So, she asks for the loan to pay for purchasing.

Yen T. N. is 40 years old with two children. One of them is attending college. She has a shop that sells electronic appliances in Xa market. Currently, she  wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to invest in her shop.

loans.name: Mon

texts.en:
Mon M., 50, is a medium-income person living in Phnom Penh City of Cambodia. She is a good and determined single mother who tries to feed her seven children, even though she is recently divorced from her husband. She has two married children who live separately, while the remainder are staying in the family home and working in a variety of jobs. 

To earn a living, Mon M. sells fresh fish in the market with her daughter. Every day in the late morning, Mon M. goes to a place that is full of fisherman to buy fish in bulk. Then she hurries to take the fish to the market. Because her income is just enough for the family’s daily expenses, her old car broke down when she was picking up the fish to sell. To solve this problem, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to buy a used car to replace her old one.

loans.use: To buy a used car to replace her old one.

Currently, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy four more pigs to raise.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family.

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Huyen Thi Duong's Group

texts.en:
Huyen T. D. is 32 years old with three children. One of them works in an industrial park. She is a farmer. Focusing on growing clean vegetables and selling them to supermarkets since 2005, she earns a stable income to support her family.

As a client since 2004, she has used her loans very effectively in business. Currently, she would like a loan of 6,322,000 VND to buy more kinds of high-yielding baby vegetables to grow as a winter crop.

About the Other Borrowers:

1) Hue T. T. is 56 years old with three children who are married. As a farmer she grows flowers in a paddy of 1,440 square meters. She would like a loan of 3,760,000 VND to buy fertilizer. 2) Tuong T. M. H. is 48 years old with two children who are in high school. She is a farmer who grows flowers to sell at retail. She would like a loan of 1,962,000 VND to buy seed for the next season.

loans.use: To buy more kinds of high-yielding baby vegetables

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia tiene 32 años de edad, es soltara y tiene un hijo a su cargo. Reside en uno de las zonas urbano marginales de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Una ciudad comercial que en estos últimos años ha venido experimentando un crecimiento demográfico considerable.

Se dedica desde hace más de cuatro años a vender cerveza y comida en un pequeño bar ubicado en una de las calles céntricas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. El negocio le ha permitido salir adelante durante este tiempo y gracias a él solventa sus gastos familiares. Actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija que siempre recurre a su establecimiento gracias al trato amable con el que son atendidos.

Herminia desea mejorar su negocio adquiriendo algunos insumos que le permitan preparar más platos de comida, así como también desea adquirir más cervezas y realizar algunas mejoras en el local donde atiende. Para ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Herminia es una persona luchadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor anhelo es seguir expandiendo su negocio para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Herminia is 32 years old, single, and has one child in her care. She lives in one of the outer suburbs of the city of Chiclayo. This is a commercial city that has experienced considerable demographic growth in recent years. 
For more than 4 years, she has been selling beer and food in a small bar located in one of the central streets of the city of Chiclayo. This business has enabled her to be improve her situation during this time and support the family expenses. She currently has regular clients who always return to her establishment thanks to the kind treatment that she shows them.
Herminia wants to improve her business buy acquiring supplies that would let her prepare more types of food and she also wants to sell more types of beer and make some improvements to the bar premises. For this reason, she has requested a loan of $725 from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her to achieve her objective.  
Herminia is a hardworking person who wants to be successful. Her main desire is to keep growing her business and to be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies to grow her business selling beer and food.

loans.name: Toan

texts.en:
Toan T. N. is 52 years old with three children, two of whom are getting married. She is a farmer who grows rice, beans, and vegetables. Toan’s agricultural products are used to support her family and meet their food demand. Additionally, Toan raises 200 chickens to provide eggs for sale. She sells her eggs wholesale to a merchant. 

Toan has been a responsible borrower in the past with SEDA. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy food for her hens.

loans.use: to buy food for hens

loans.name: Juana Mabel

texts.es:
Juana tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, una ciudad bastante comercial y que ha venido experimentando un crecimiento acelerado durante los últimos años. Es la capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a la preparación y venta de pasteles y tortas. Ella brinda su servicio para personas que celebren ocasiones especiales como cumpleaños, aniversarios, etc. Debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando en esta actividad se ha vuelto conocida en el rubro y actualmente cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sostener la economía familiar.

Juana desea adquirir algunos insumos para ampliar su producción de pasteles y percibir mayor número de ganancias ya que se acerca la época del año en que se programan las fiestas de promoción de los colegios, para lo cual siempre le solicitan pedidos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Juana es una mujer tranquila y bastante trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria y empezar a distribuir sus papeles a mayor escala.
texts.en:
Juana, 56, is single and has a son.  She lives in the city of Chiclayo, a quite commercial city that has been undergoing accelerated growth over the last few years.  It is the capital of Lambayeque region.

For the last ten years she has been making cakes and pastries to sell.  She provides her service to people who are celebrating special occasions like birthdays, anniversaries, etc. Thanks to the time she’s been in business she has become very well known in the field and she currently has a base of regular customers.  Income from this activity provides family support.

Juana wants to acquire some ingredients to expand her cake production thus earning more profits because the time of year when graduation parties in schools is fast approaching and orders will be placed with her.  She is, therefore, asking for her first, 500 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

Juana is a mature, quite hard working woman.  Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman and to start selling her cakes in a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her cake and pastry making business.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um B. is a 54-year-old public officer who works in province of Kompong Chhnang. Her husband, Net Nat, is 60 and works in the farming business. Net Nat inherited the farmland where he and his wife grow different kinds of crops.This couple is blessed with four kids, one of whom is attending the public high school, the other three are married. Another source of income comes from her son who is a fish seller. This is the rainy season; her son house needs repairs and the roof of his house is torn because of strong winds. Um B. wants to help him, but she doesn’t have enough money to support the repairs.  Um B. requested a loan from Kiva to hire construction workers to repair her son house.

loans.use: To hire construction workers to repair her son's house.

loans.name: Amartuvshin

texts.en: Amartuvshin T. is a 22 years old young man who lives in his own ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent, in his uncle's yard, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Amartuvshin operates a taxi service between two sub provinces. He began driving in 2007 by helping his brother's transportation business and since 2008, he started to run a taxi service independently after  purchasing his own car. With his earnings plus his parents' money, he was able to purchase a new Honda Accent which is better than his previous car, in January, 2010. Amartuvshin is a very modest, optimistic man. He is planning on purchasing a new micro bus and expand his business. He is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to repair his car and change his engine.

loans.use: To repair his car and change his engine

loans.name: Ngach

texts.en:
Ngach T. N. is 55 years old and has five children. Three of them are jobless. Ngach runs a shop that sells fresh vegetables and chicken meat in the local market and earns 100,000 VND in daily profits. Her business has been in operation for many years. Although her children are trying to find work, the family cannot currently cover big expenditures. Ngach also focuses on raising poultry and wants to raise more chickens for meat to provide for the market demand during the Tet holiday. 

Ngach is requesting a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy 100 chickens and build a chicken coop.

loans.use: to buy chickens and build a chicken coop

loans.name: Nestor Julio

texts.es:
Néstor tiene 57 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su madre en un caserío del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Piura y ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la agricultura para ganarse la vida, cuenta con una pequeña parcela de cultivo donde suele sembrar mango y limón, el cosecha estos productos y los ofrece en venta a las plantas procesadoras que se encuentran ubicadas en la zona en donde vive. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad el se encarga de sacar adelante a su madre.

Néstor quiere brindar mantenimiento a sus cultivos para asegurarse una buena producción de los mismos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de de fertilizantes y pesticidas.

El es alguien bastante tranquilo y responsable. Las personas que le conocen le consideran alguien honesto y de confianza.
texts.en:
Nestor is 57 years old, he is single and he lives together with his mom in a community in the agricultural district of Tambogrande. It is a region in the Piura province located more than three hours and a half away from the city of Chiclayo. 

He is an agriculturist and he has a small parcel of land where he cultivates mangoes and lemons. He sells his produce to the processing companies located in the same region where he lives. He uses his earnings from the business to support his mother. 

Nestor wants to provide some necessary maintenance to the plantations to ensure a good yield. To this end he has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles. He will invest the funds in the purchase of fertilizers and pesticides.

He is a calm and responsible person. Those who know him consider him to be an honest and trustworthy person.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his mango and lemon plantations.

loans.name: Nazyhan's Group

texts.en:
Nazyhan D. is the leader of the group. She is 54, a widow. Dhe has 4 children, the eldest one is married and lives separately, another 2 work in Russia and the youngest daughter is a schoolgirl. Nazyhan runs her own business, she has a canteen in the center of the village. Six years ago she had used to cook different dishes at home and sell them in the local market. Out of the profits she has managed to build the canteen and also to obtain cattle. The loan purpose is to open a mini bar in the canteen. In the future Nazyhan is planning to open a café in her village.

Buraima O., is 49 and married. Her husband is a tractor operator. The couple has 4 children,. The eldest son helps his father and the elder daughter is a student. The rest of the children are engaged in rice cultivating. The family enlarges their budget by selling rice. Six years ago after having harvested 10 tons of rice they started to sell it at retail. Out of profits, they are paying daughter’s school fees. Also they have managed to organize their son’s wedding. The loan purpose is to purchase 400 kg of rice for further resale. In the future Buraima wants to open a foodstuff shop in the village.

Salim A., 58 is married. His wife makes her income by working as a charwoman and a cook in the local school. The couple has 3 children. The family earns money by selling rice. They have been doing this for 10 years. The profits have made possible their son’s wedding and house repairs. The loan purpose is to purchase 250 kg of rice for resale. In the nearer future Salim is planning to obtain a car.

Yhval A. is 49 and married. Their family has 2 sons, both of them have jobs in Russia. The family raises money by selling rice. Five years ago they had bought 250 kg of rice for resale, since then their business has made a good incoming. Out of profits the family has managed to build a bath-house,  obtain a car, TV-set and DVD-player. The loan purpose is to increase their stock by purchasing 750 kg of rice. Yhval in the future plans to breed cattle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to open a mini bar

loans.name: Tien

texts.en: Tien T. N. is 53 years old with four children, two of whom are attending college. She is a farmer who goes to the field every day to tend to her 2,500 square meter rice paddy where she also grows eggplant. Additionally, Tien raises 200 chickens to provide eggs for sale. Her monthly income of 3,500,000 VND does not cover big monthly expenditures. Tien wants to expand her egg business by adding 100 more hens. She is therefore requesting a 7,630,000 VND loan to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hens and expand her business

loans.name: Erdenedalai

texts.en:
Erdenedalai D. is 26 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends local kindergarten while his wife is pregnant. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in his mother's yard. 

Erdenedalai and his wife operate a men's clothing retail business out of from the stall at Narantuul, the largest indoor market in Ulaanbaatar. He has been engaged this business since 2007. After finding success and achieving stable business operations, he has used his earnings to purchase new car, which has decreased his working capital. 

Today, his working capital exceeds 1,300,000 Mongolian Tugrug (MNT). For the future, he would like to have another stall to expand his business and increase his sales. Erdenedalai is a very modest man. He is requesting a  2,600,000 MNT loan to import more men's winter clothes from China.

loans.use: importing more men's winter clothes

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira C. is the leader of the group. She is 32 and married. Her family has five children. All the children except youngest one are school pupils. Gulmira’s husband supports the family by selling cattle. Four years ago, he was a teacher. He began selling farm animals. Now he has two cows. The loan purpose is to purchase cattle. In the future Gulmira is planning to increase the total number of cattle.

Sharipa N., 36, is married. Her spouse is a private taxi-driver. The couple has four children who are all school pupils. Sharipa runs her own business sewing national wares (national pillows, blankets and so on). She has been doing this for 15 years. After finishing school, she started to take small orders at home. Out of the profits, she bought a car and cattle. The loan purpose is to purchase goats. Sharipa, together with her family, is planning to make major house repairs and obtain an automobile.

Mamaturaim I., 52, is married. His wife earns money by working as a seamstress. The couple has five children. The eldest son works in Bishkek, the daughter is a student, one is working in Russia, and the youngest daughter is a schoolgirl. The whole family is engaged in cattle breeding. Eight years ago, Mamaturaim made his bread by selling automobile spare parts. With the profit, he has been buying livestock animals. By now, his earnings make it possible to pay for his daughter’s studies. The loan purpose is to purchase two calves. This father aims to put his children on their own feet.

Aitilla K., 50, is married. Her family has four children. Her daughter is married and lives in Bishkek. Her elder son lives in Kara-Balta, another one is a herder and the youngest son is a private builder. The family runs a business breeding cattle. Due to years of working hard, they have managed to increase the cattle stock and purchase a house. The loan purpose is to obtain livestock animals. Aitilla is planning to build a house and to arrange her son’s wedding.

Altynai A., 31, is married. Her family has three children. The oldest children are school pupils. Altynai’s husband's profession is carpentry and he breeds cattle. In six years, they have managed to increase the total number of animals. Now they keep 4 cows and 2 calves. The loan purpose is to purchase cattle. The family intends to build a new house and to increase cattle stock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es:
María Anita es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en un caserío del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona perteneciente a la provincia de Piura y ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a más de tres horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de bebidas cervezas y gaseosas en un local acondicionado en su vivienda, sus principales clientes son las personas que viven en su caserío. Los ingresos que recibe de estas actividades los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo, que es agricultor, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más bebidas para comercializarlas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su meta.

María Anita se caracteriza por ser una persona honesta y entregada a su familia. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Maria Anita is a mom, she is 32 years old and she lives together with her husband and their three children in an agricultural community in Tambogrande. It is a region located in the province of Piura, more than three and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. 

She sells beer and soft drinks from a store fashioned from a section in her house. His main clients are the neighbors in her community. The profits she earns she uses to contribute with her husband to the family's finances. He is an agriculturist. 

She wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more drinks for resale. She has requested a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles and it will help her reach her goal. 

María Anita is known as a very honest person and very devoted to her family. Those that know her consider her to be a calm and responsible person.

loans.use: To purchase drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Erdenesuren

texts.en: Erdenesuren C. is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family have lived together in their own apartment for the past 11 years. Both her two sons attend local high school. Her husband works as a welder and electrician in the mine in the summer months and as a plumber during the winter months. Erdenesuren sells a variety of consumer goods in a pavilion at the outdoor space at a market. She started her business in 2005 by operating a cafe with help of her husband in Uyanga sub province. In 2007, she began selling a variety of socks outside of the local market after moving her current town. She could not create a stable operation and stopped her business for a while when her husband worked in the mine. She restarted her retail trading business in September 2008 and her current working capital has reached 1,500,000 MNT today. Erdenesuren is a hardworking and optimistic woman.  She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to increase her product line in order to raise her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more consumer products

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung T. N. is 49 years old with two children who are in college. Her husband is in construction. Providing tuition for her children is very difficult. Being a farmer, she mainly grows rice and vegetables and raises 200 chickens for their eggs. She sells eggs at both wholesale and retail to earn a daily income.

As a member of SEDA since 2004, she has used loans effectively in expanding her farm. Currently, she would like a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens. Her biggest dream in life is providing good living conditions for her children.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Givaa

texts.en: Givaa B. is a 25-year-old single woman who lives with her parents in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. She and her parents live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Givaa has been operating a cafe and computer service business since 2009 and relies on her parents’ previous experience of running a cafe. In the near future, she is planning to open a consumer goods business in a rented stall at the Baku trade center.  She is planning to have her boyfriend be responsible for managing the cafe business while she operates her retail business. Givaa is a modest, optimistic, and hard working woman who really wants to expand her businesses. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more food supplies for her cafe and buy a variety of consumer goods for her new business.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies

loans.name: Aina's Group

texts.en: Aina U. is the leader of the group. She is 45 and married. Her family has two children: The son currently works in Russia, while the daughter is a military-registration worker at the enlistment office. Six years ago, the family inherited four head of cattle. Since then, they have been breeding cattle. During these years they have increased their cattle stock and by now, they are keeping 15 animals. Their loan purpose is for purchasing livestock for their further resale. In the future, Aina is planning to open a foodstuffs shop. Chynarkul S., 52, is a widow. She has three children: The eldest raises money by working as a welder; another son is a manager; and the youngest daughter is a student at the International University in Kyrgyzstan. The family is engaged in cattle breeding. Out of the profits, they have managed to build a house. The loan purpose is to buy two sheep for breeding. In the future, Chynarkul wants to arrange her children’s weddings, then to purchase a car. Batima D., 47, is a widow. She takes care of four children. The elder daughters are married, while the younger children are school pupils. The family runs their own business, which consists of cattle breeding. Batima’s brother was engaged in this business and he advised his sister to do the same. Out of the profits, they have managed to obtain furniture. The family needs to get a loan in order to buy a bull for increasing their total number of cattle. In the future, Batima intends to purchase a big house and make it comfortable for living, and also to put her children on their feet. Gulasyl B., 31, is married. Her spouse is a builder. The couple has two children: The daughter is a schoolgirl, while the son is of preschool age. The main family income comes from poultry breeding. By now they have 10 hens and 20 chickens. The loan purpose is to obtain turkey cocks and hens for their fattening and resale. Gulasyl is planning to increase the total number of turkeys and hens. Marapat K., 41, is married. Her spouse is a post head. The couple is bringing up five children: The eldest son has a job in Bishkek, while the rest are dependent on their parents for support. The family is fattening hens for sale. Two years ago, Marapat had bought five hens and began to breed them. During these years, she has managed to increase the total number of hens to 17 birds. The loan purpose is to obtain hens (layers) for egg selling. In the future, the family wants to open a mini-hatchery. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for breeding

loans.name: Javzanpagma

texts.en:
Javzanpagma D. is a 50-year-old single mother. She lives with her two daughters in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her oldest daughter is a university student while her youngest daughter attends a local high school. 

Javzanpagma operates a women's clothing retail business from a stall at Night's Market, the only market that opens at night. She started her women's clothing business in 2005 and has built a stable and successful operation. Today, her working capital exceeds 1,300,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) and she has daily average profits of 50,000 MNT. 

Javzanpagma says, "All I want is to provide (a) nice and healthy life for both my daughters." 

She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more women's winter clothing items in order to increase her sales and profits.

loans.use: To purchase more women's winter clothing

loans.name: Shirin's Group

texts.en: Shirin M. is the leader of the group. She is 48 and divorced. She has two daughters: The elder one is an operator, while the younger is an accountant. The family has their own shop called “For You” and Shirin’s brother helps to run the business. Last year, her mother presented her with a cow, which was further fattened and resold. Out of the profits, she managed to open the shop. The loan purpose is to purchase a milk cow in order to sell dairy products in the shop. Shirin cherishes a dream to arrange her daughters’ weddings. Oksana U. 25, is divorced. She is bringing up two children alone: The daughter is a school girl, while the son is a toddler. The mother earns her livelihood by working as the operator in the “Abdysh-Ata” company. Three years ago, her mother-in-law presented her with a cow, and since that time, she has been breeding cattle. Out of the profits, she could afford to obtain furniture and household appliances. The loan purpose is to buy four animals for fattening until next year, then out of the resale profits, she is planning to purchase new furniture. In the future, her aim is to obtain a flat in Kant city. Roza C., 45, is married. She is the treasurer of the group. Her spouse is a cattle-farm worker. The couple has four children: The eldest daughter raises money by working as a saleswoman in a shop, another two are students and the youngest one is a schoolboy. Roza has work as a saleswoman in the shop “Exclusive.” Besides that, the family is engaged in cattle breeding. Earnings made it possible to give a university education to the children. The loan purpose is to purchase three calves. In the future, Roza wants to make shop repairs. Abdyrashid D., 25, is divorced. He has a profession of being the investigator in the District Department of Inner Affairs. On his salary, he has managed to purchase a crusher and a saw. The loan purpose is to obtain two calves for their further fattening. In the future, Abdyrashid is planning to purchase an automobile and also to remarry. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Progress his business

loans.name: Myagmarsuren

texts.en: Myagmarsuren S. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Huvsgul province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her oldest daughter is a university student while her two children attend local secondary school. Myagmarsuren operates a household's good retail business with the help of her husband. She sells a variety of household's consumer goods while her husband helps her to repair an electric products for sale. Myagmarsuren started her business in 2008 selling a stationaries at the local market. After finding success and achieving stable business operations within short period, she expanded her product line to include a variety of household's consumer goods. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her daughter's tuition fees. Myagmarsuren is a hardworking and modest woman. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more variety of stationaries and households's products in order to increase her product line for her retail business.

loans.use: To purchase additional variety of stationary

loans.name: Kalbubu's Group

texts.en:
Kalbubu B. is the leader of the group. She is 52, married. Her husband earns money by working as a school watchman. The couple has 3 children, including the youngest son who helps parents in keeping house. The whole family has been engaged in cattle breeding since 1990. Kalbubu hopes to get a loan for purchasing more cattle (livestock animals). In the future, the family is planning to increase cattle stock and also arrange a son’s wedding.

Jumabubu S., 50, married. Her family has 4 children, all of them help their parents to breed cattle. She started this business 20 years ago following her father’s advice. During these years, they have managed to increase the total number of animals. The loan purpose is to purchase more cattle for further fattening and breeding. Jumabubu and her family hope to improve their wealth by increasing cattle stock.

Gulayim S. has the status of group treasurer. She is 50, married. Her husband is a worker of administrative department. The couple has 2 children; the son raises money by working in Bishkek, the daughter is a student. The family has run their own cattle breeding business since 1994. Their loan purpose is to obtain livestock animals in order to increase their total number of cattle. In the future, Gulayim aims to give proper education to the daughter.

Uson K., 45, married. His wife is a private entrepreneur. The couple has 4 children, one of them is a student, the rest of which help parents in keeping house. The family makes their bread by selling consumer retail goods, following his brother’s advice. Out of profits, they wish to afford to obtain necessary household appliances. The loan purpose is to purchase 3 livestock animals. Later, Uson aims to increase cattle stock, then to enlarge commodity circulation.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Voi

texts.en:
Voi T. N. is 55 years old with five children. She has been a noodle maker for many years. Every day she makes noodles from fifteen kilos of rice. Her good-quality product sells well at retail in local markets. She earns a 100,000 VND profit from this activity.

As a member of our credit program since 2004, she has been a good borrower. Now she would like a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy five pigs which she intends to raise next month.

loans.use: To buy five pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Purchase seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria L. is from the village of Wigan Cordon. She is 28 years old. Maria is single. To make a living, Maria owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from catching and selling fresh-water fish to the market. Maria has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Maria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Maria is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Maria from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Rosalin Orcullo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosalin O., 33 years of age, married, is a resident of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Rosalin is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosalin Orcullos’s Group.
Rosalin is married to Walther, a security guard of Johanne’s Cuisine. They are blessed with 2 children of school age. To help her husband, she decided to engage in micro business particularly in processing fish ball for her snack vending activity.  For 2 years already, she has been able to maintain the said business activity and this time she is earning an average net income of not less than P3,500.00 a month in which the said amount is so helpful to their family income. Upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC for being one of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao and awarded coop for being Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006 and awarded for CUMI Performance Award she joined  the cooperative just this year. As a newly recognized member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reached out the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of P5,000.00 as her 1st loan to be used for additional capital for her fish ball vending activity. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, make loan repayments to PMPC, provide for their children’s education and for possible business expansions.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish ball vending business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: For her husband's carpentry shop

loans.name: Edik

texts.en:
Edik M. was born in 1957 in Sarighygh village, Ijevan area. He is married and has three sons: The eldest one is a student, the middle son lives and works in Russia, and the youngest one serves in the Armenian Army. From 1988 until 1992, Edik participated in the Nagorno-Karabakh war conflict.

In 2003, Edik organized his own business: He takes an order and sews clothes. He sews men’s and women’s suits and trousers, and leather outerwear as well. Edik makes clothes from raw materials that he bought himself and he also sews from materials that his clients bring to him. 

Edik says his work is very hard and at the same time, it is very profitable, so he can support his family.

Edik asks for a 300.000 Armenian drams loan to buy raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for his business

loans.name: Chinara's Group

texts.en:
Chinara A. is the leader of the group. She is 48 and is married with two daughters and two sons. The sons are private entrepreneurs and the daughters are students.  Chinara and her husband are farmers who breed cattle and cultivate fruit and vegetables.  They earn 14000 soms per month by selling their fattened cattle and a portion of their harvest.  Chinara is requesting the loan to help pay for dental services.  In the future she wants to purchase a vehicle and build a house for her sons. 

Gulbara K. is the treasurer of the group.  She is 44 and married.  She has a son, who attends university and earns money by selling jeans in the market in his free time.  Gulbara and her husband breed cattle. With money received from the loan they want to purchase a bull in order to resell it at a higher price after fattening it.
 
Gulkair O. is 35 and is married with two daughters. The first daughter is at school and the second is not yet.  Gulkair and her husband are farmers who cultivate fruit and vegetables. Gulkair is requesting the loan to help pay for dental services.

Bahrnisa K. is 52 and is a widow. She has a daughter and a son.  Bahrnisa breeds cattle, and with the money received from the loan she wants to purchase cement in order to build a shed for her cattle. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To pay for dental services

loans.name: Debie Reynette

texts.en: Debie Reynette M. is from the village of Wigan, Santiago. She is 40 years old. Debie Reynette is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Debie Reynette runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Debie Reynette has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2009, Debie Reynette joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Debie Reynette has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Debie Reynette is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Debie Reynette from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dina Pangasian's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dina P., 53 years of age, is married. She is a resident of Tabid, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. Dina is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dina P.’s Group.

Dina is married to Zosimo, a motor cab driver. They were blessed with four children, three of whom are now at their adult stage and the other one is still school age. To help her husband, she decided to engage in a micro business, particularly in operating a sari-sari (variety) store and vending some snacks. 

For 10 years already, she has been able to maintain the said business activity and at this time, she is earning an average net income of not less than 3,000.00 Philippines pesos a month. This amount is so helpful to her family income. 

Upon hearing the good news of PAGLAUM MPC being one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, being an awarded coop for Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006, and being awarded for CUMI Performance Award 2010, she undoubtedly joined the cooperative in the year 2009. 

As an active member of the PDP-LP Program of PAGLAUM MPC, a micro-finance program that reaches out to the rural poor, she is requesting an amount of 10,000.00 pesos as her fourth loan to be used as additional capital for her sari-sari store. The future income from this loan will be used to improve the living conditions for her family, to meet their basic needs, loan repayments to PMPC, house renovation and for possible business expansions.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing sari-sari (variety) store and snack vending business

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica D. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 35 years old. Jessica is married and has 4 children. Her eldest child is 14 years old, and her youngest is only 2 months old. Jessica earns income through farming and hog-raising. She plants and harvests rice crops for sale. She grows pigs for fattening, and sells the pigs to the market. Jessica hired some laborers to help at her farm because she just gave birth to her youngest child.

Jessica joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer and feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and feed

loans.name: Lestina Mentang Group

texts.en:
Lestina M. is from the village of Tonggo, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old. Lestina is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Lestina M. Group.

Lestina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lestina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Lestina has been engaged in her business for over 8 years, and earns approximately 6,400 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Lestina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lestina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Lestina is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Lestina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Lubna's Group

texts.en:
Lubna is a resident of Jaranwala, which is a small city in Pakistan that is famous for its agriculture industry. She has lived with her family in a 2-room brick house for the last nine years. 

She is a 29 year old housewife who spends most of her time at home taking care of her household responsibilities. She is married to M. R. and has no children. 

Her husband is a salesman and sells edible items (candies and chocolates) to different shops to put three meals on their table. He buys the items on wholesale, and he generates income by selling them to different shops. He is the only breadwinner of the family, and this makes him more responsible towards his obligations.
  
Lubna has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy the edible items on wholesale and increase his sales. He has been running this business for the last 8 years, and Lubna is hopeful that this investment will become profitable for his business. 

She is a regular loan borrower with Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year she built good credit behavior and has attended all required meetings.

Note: In the photo, the lady who holds the book (the Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Lubna.

loans.use: To buy candies and chocolates on wholesale to resell

texts.ru:
Giyas M. 54 qoda. On jenat i imeyet ondoqo rebonka. Giyas yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli regiona, i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli region, paselok Kurdmahmudlu.

Giyas uje 9 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom skotovodstva. Eto uje vtoroy ssud Giyasa v perviy ssudu on bral 800$ i kupil 8 baranov. Seycha on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit  baranov dlya pereprodaji.

http://partners.kiva.org/lend/7356
texts.en:
Giyas M. is 54 years old.  He is married and has one child.  Giyas has relocated from the Fuzuli region and now lives in the village of Kurdmahmudlu.

Giyas has been breeding livestock for nine years now.  This is the second time Giyas is taking out a loan, the first time he took out $800USD to buy eight sheep.  At this time he needs 2000AZN to buy sheep for resale.

loans.name: Asma's Group

texts.en:
Asma lives in a two-room brick house with her family in a city named Jaranwala, which is located in Punjab Pakistan and is famous for its agriculture industry. She is a housewife, stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  She is the mother of two daughters who are less than four years of age. 

Her husband has a business selling flavored juice in cartons. He supplies the juice in cartons to different general stores in the city. He gets the juice in cartons at wholesale and earns a good profit by selling them.  He is the only breadwinner of his family and as his daughters are growing, he has to face their education expenses as well.  So in order to complete their needs, he has to grow his business. 
 
That’s why Asma has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy cartons of juice in bulk quantity and increase his selling. Asma is hopeful that by investing money, her husband’s business will improve and she will be able to send her daughters to school when they become of school-going age. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. In the previous loan year, she built good credit behavior and attended every meeting. 

Note: "In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hand is Asma".

loans.use: To buy cartons of flavored juice in bulk quantity for reselling

loans.name: Thou's Group

texts.en:
This loan group is made up of five borrowers who are shown in the picture. The group leader, Mrs. Thou M., is 41 years old. She currently is a widowed mother of two children. She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dR. seasons. The coming rainfall is good for growing crops. This is an annual action with which she has had great success. Currently she wants to plant more vegetables in her farmland in order to earn extra income for the family needs. Mrs. Thou M. said that she doesn’t have capital to make it possible. So Mrs. Thou M. is looking for a loan to use to purchase seeds for planting in her farmland.

There are four other borrowers in this group who have requested a loan as follows: 
Mrs. P., a farmer, is asking for a loan to buy more nets and hooks to fish for extra income. 
Mr. K. needs a loan to purchase nets and traps for fishing activity.
Mrs. S., a fish catcher, is asking for a loan to buy some nets and hooks to support her fishing business.
Mrs. R., a farmer, is hoping to make additional income by requesting a loan to purchase fishing tools to fish.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting in her farmland.

Tserenpil currently operates a transportation business in the city, using a van that he owns. He enjoys the work. He started his business in 2006, after obtaining a loan to purchase his van. He has found much success as a driver. He and his wife purchased a 2000-year-model van last autumn. He says the loans have changed his life and he appreciates that.

He is requesting a loan to purchase and install a heating system, which has a boiler and a stove, in his house.
