texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 29-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He is a new business owner. He opened a vegetable shop in 2007. In addition, he has prepared a corner where he buys fresh juices. He is the main income provider for his wife and two children. He takes care of the family expenses and the school fees. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sickness and schooling and at the same time run a business. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business and increase his purchases. In the future, he is planning to open a juice shop.

loans.use: To improve his business and increase his stock

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine K. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste and some smaller items. She is requesting a loan to buy more items and some new ones to sell in order to increase business.  

Christine is 38 years old and widowed. She has seven children and four of her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy goats and chickens to keep at home.

loans.use: Buy more items to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia N. is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Lydia has a business of making charcoal stoves, which she has done for two years.         

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clay soil.  

With the help of the loan from BRAC, Lydia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her siblings and pay for food. In the future, Lydia hopes to go back to school and own a retail shop. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her about computers and providing counseling and guidance.

loans.use: More clay soil for making charcoal stoves

loans.name: Nkongoro Goat Rearing, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
Hard-working Wilson M. K. started up his transport business four years ago with motorcycles commonly known as “boda boda.” These are a common means of transport and are convenient in timely situations like traffic jams and the bad road systems in Uganda. He has made a good profit out of it, earning 280,000 Ugandan shillings monthly. 

His main setback is that he needs to expand the business by buying additional motorcycles and allocating them in different stages so as to increase his revenue. His future plan is to buy a car for "matatu" (taxi) usage to earn him more money. With this loan, he hopes to achieve that aforementioned goal and thus will be able to take care of his family. Wilson belongs to the Nkongoro Goat Rearing Group.

loans.use: Purchase of another motorcycle

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia P. is 30 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children. Her husband is a driver. Julia is currently in the business of distilling and selling local alcohol.  She is requesting a loan to stock more distillation materials. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more distillation materials

loans.name: Ko'eju Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio kennedy de la ciudad de Caacupé. 
Son Señoras muy unidas, ya hace aproximadamente 6 a7 años que están dentro del programa, realizan constantes actividades juntas, de ese modo ahorran y también cuentan con una caja chica que les sirve como garantía para cualquier inconveniente que se presente.
Ellas están muy agradecidas con la Fundación y Kiva, por la oportunidad y por las contantes capacitaciones que reciben. 
Gracias al programa, aprendieron a ahorrar, trabajar en equipo, y crear fuentes de ingresos, que les ayudan al sustento de sus hogares, ya que algunas son cabezas de familia.
Una de las integrantes quien es muy trabajadora y activa para las actividades que realiza el comité es la señora Gloria.
Ella es comerciante desde hace varios años, y es la abastecedora de los productos de primera necesidad del barrio. 
La señora  Gloria tiene una familia muy unida, y se ayudan mutuamente en todas las actividades que realizan y de esta manera la familia sale adelante de la mejor manera posible. 
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su negocio ya que en ocasiones también tiene clientes que solicitan las mercaderías a crédito y los pagan de manera mensual o quincenal, y necesita para comprar, arroz, aceite, fideos, enlatados, lácteos, panificados, embutidos, yerba mate, productos de limpieza.
texts.en:
The women in this group are from the Kennedy neighborhood in the city of Caacupé. These united women have already been in this program for about 6 to 7 years. They regularly pursue activities together. They not only save their money, but they also have a savings account, which they use as a guarantee against any unforeseen obstacles that arise. They are very thankful for Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for this opportunity and for the constant training they receive. Thanks to the program, they learn to save, work in teams, and create sources of income that help their support their families since some of these women are heads of households. 

Gloria is a very hard-working and active member of the group. She has been a businesswoman for many years, and she supplies necessary goods for her neighborhood. Mrs. Gloria has a very close family, and they help to support each other. In this way, her family goes forward in the best way possible. At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business because sometimes her clients buy goods on credit. They repay her monthly or twice monthly. With this loan, she will buy rice, oil, noodles, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods, cured meat, mate leaves (used as a substitute for tea), and cleaning products.

loans.use: To buy rice, oil, noodles, canned goods, dairy products, baked goods, mate leaves, and cleaning products

loans.name: Rejowa

texts.en: Rejowa M. is 38 years old, married, and has four school-aged children.  Her husband is a secretary. Rejowa  is currently in the business of selling food stuffs in a restaurant.  She is requesting a loan to buy more food stuffs and open a new retail shop.   With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a house in the future.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs and open a new retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is 53 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She has been running a clothing store for the past six years. She only sells woman clothes. She always presents new collections to attract more clients to her shop. Her business income is vital for her family as she  supports her husband. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory of new winter clothing. She is certain that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to also sell shoes in her store.

loans.use: To expand her store’s inventory of new winter clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay off his car loan repayment

loans.name: Muhumuza Women Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: Rudia T. is a member of the Muhumuza Women group, Ntungamo. Hard working and determined, she has been operating a restaurant in Ntungamo where she prepares milk tea and other local meals. She earns 240,000 Ugandan shillings per month, which is an improvement over her former business of selling second-hand clothes.  Rudia is married and has four children.  She is working hard to see that all her children acquire an education and in attempt to achieve this she sold her cow for starting capital for her business. She is requesting a loan to help her expand her business and increase her revenue, which will enable her to meet the daily life expenses.

loans.use: To buy foods and other restaurant inputs

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
L. señora Mercedes es socia del Bancomunal Arrieros, tiene 32 años, 2 hijos D. 14 y 11 años D. edada, los cuales están estudiando, el primero esta en cuarto año D. secundaria y L. ùltima esta en sexto grado D. primaria. Mercedes se dedica a L. venta D. quesos y carne D. cordero, estos productos lo reparte a sus clientes, quienes le pagan D. manera mensual; también se ayuda vendiendo papa rellena en el Colegio Froebel y tambien venD. ropa.
El préstamo que solicita lo va ha invertir en L. compra D. ropas variadas para venderlas en las Comunidades D. Muyurina y Chacco. Anteriormente, del 2002 al 2007, vendía en un cafetín escolar pero por motivos que le subieron el alquiler del local y no había mucha venta decidió cambiar D. negocio. 
Afortunadamente Mercedes no ha tenido dificultades en los negocios que tiene actualmente porque sus clientes son puntuales en lo pagos. Mercedes se siente muy contenta D. ser socia D. Finca Perú ya que gracias a las capacitaciones aprendió como ahorrar y a ser puntual en sus actividades cotidianas. su sueño es tener una casa propia y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Señora Mercedes is a member of the community bank Arrieros (Muleteers). She is 32 year old and has two children, ages 14 and 11, who are in school. The older is in the 4th year of secondary school, and the younger is in the sixth graD. of primary school. Mercedes sells cheese and lamb meat, which she splits up among her customers, who pay her monthly. She also helps herself by selling stuffed potatoes at the Froebel School, and in addition she sells clothing.

She will invest the loan that she is applying for in the purchase of a variety of clothing to sell in the communities of Muyurina and Chacco. In the past, from 2002 to 2007, she sold food in a school cafeteria, but because they raised her rent and she didn't have many sales, she decided to change her business. Fortunately, Mercedes has not had difficulties in the businesses she has now, because her customers are punctual in their payments. Mercedes feels very happy to be a member of Finca Peru, because thanks to the training she learned how to save and be punctual in her daily activities. Her dream is to have her own house and to have her business grow.

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza P. is currently in the business of selling cakes and bread and is requesting a loan to stock other items like tomatoes and onions to sell.  

Eliza is 20 years old and married to a welder. She has three children, one of whom goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children who do not go to school.

loans.use: Stock other items like tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en: Ramin B. is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He started his small convenience store when he was unemployed and needed a way to pay the bills. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell seasonal fruits and vegetables. With the loan, Ramin expects to keep growing his business little by little and keep improving his quality of life and economic situation until he achieves his goal. He has applied for a loan of 1000 AZN.

loans.use: purchase more seasonal fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah N. is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is single and has no children.  Norah has had a a library business for a year.         

To help expand her business, Norah has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase cosmetics. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Norah hopes to expand her business, generate greater profits and take care of herself in the future. She  is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects through new friends and sharing ideas.

loans.use: buy cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Kameme Bakyara Kweterana, Kihihi Group

texts.en: N. Moses, aged 40, (with hand raised) operates a retail shop for general merchandise in Kihihi trading centre. He manages to earn some money, (400,000 a month) to fulfill his life and feed his family of six children. It is always difficult to build a strong businesses from scratch and Moses began his business with very little capital. He is seeking a loan to expand his business and purchase enough stock to meet the needs of his customers. With more stock, he will be able to earn profits. Moses belongs to Kameme Bakyara kweterana, Kihihi.

loans.use: Increase his inventory.

loans.name: Plasidia

texts.en: K. Plasidia, aged 34, has maintained a banana plantation, alongside her teaching profession, for more than eight years in Kituriba, Rukungiri. Hard working and dependable, she makes an average of 100,000 Ugandan shillings a month from banana sales, which is not enough to sustain her extended family. Plasidia has persevered to keep the enterprise growing, and her aim with this loan is to buy mulch and manure for the plantation. She wants to expand into bigger markets, increase productivity, earn more revenue, and be able to live a better life and educate all her children.

loans.use: purchase manure and mulch

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine P. is in the business of selling perfume and shoes and is requesting a loan to increase her shoe stock. She is 43 years old, and a widow   with five children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He has made his life as an experienced construction worker. He is especially talented at completing big construction projects. He works closely with construction entrepreneurs. He started his business in 2000. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more tools for his newest project. In the future, he plans to open a construction office as his own business.

loans.use: To purchase more tools

loans.name: Maximina

texts.es:
Maximina es socia del Bancomunal Arrieros, tiene 37 años, 2 hijos D. 6 y 4 años, los cuales están estudiando en inicial, Maximina se dedica a L. venta D. carne D. pollo, anteriormente vendía para otra persona pero al ver que el negocio era bueno decidió independizarse y tener su propio negocio, elL. lo logro gracias al préstamo que recibió D. Finca Perú, Maximina es socia D. Finca Perú desD. hace 6 años.
Maximina solicita su prèstamo para incrementar su negocio y realizar compras en cantidad al por mayor, Maximina agradece a L. voluntad D. Dios y a su trabajo porque siempre le ha ido bien en sus ventas; por ello aumenta cada vez más su capital. 
El sueño D. Maximina es tener su casa propia y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Maximina is a member of the Arrieros Community Bank. She is 37 years old and has two children, ages 6 and 4, who are in preschool. Maximina makes a living selling chicken. Previously she sold it for someone else, but seeing that it was a good business she decided to go independent and start her own business, which she did thanks to a loan from Kiva partner Finca Peru. Maximina has been a member of Finca Peru for six years. She is requesting this loan to expand her business and purchase chicken in bulk at wholesale. Maximina is grateful to God and her work because her sales have always gone well and increases her capital every month. Her dream is to have her own home and for her children to be successful.

loans.use: Purchase chickens at wholesale

loans.name: Rebbeca

texts.en:
Rebecca C. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and clothes. She is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  

Rebecca is 38 years old and married to an army man. She has three children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a big shop.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Milton Ruben

texts.es:
Milton Ruben G. D. tiene 23 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 1 nina, Melissa, de 2 meses. 
 
Milton es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, frejol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total. 

A Milton trabaja en la finca de sus padres sembrando maíz y arroz desde hace 8 anos. Las fertilizantes y los insumos compra en las tiendas agrícolas y vende sus productos en cualquier comercial. 
Solicita el credito para invertir en la siembra de maíz y comprar los fertilizantes. Con el apoyo del credito le ayudaria económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es comprar una finca, un carro, y tener una vida economica mas suave. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar el indor fútbol y el volley.
texts.en: Milton is 23 years old, single, and lives with his parents in Cantón de Ventanas, province of Los Rios. He has a 2-month-old baby daughter, Melissa. Milton is a member of the Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) community bank, which is located 25 kilometers from Cantón de Ventanas. It is a community that makes a living in short-cycle crops (corn, rice, soya, beans, cocoa). There are 14 member overall in his community bank. Milton has been working on his parents' farm harvesting corn and rice for the past eight months. Her purchases fertilizers and other planting materials from agriculture stores and sells his products at various commercial centers. He is requesting the loan to invest in planting corn and purchasing fertilizers. The loan will help him financially to meet his necessities. His dream is to buy a farm, a car and have a smoother life financially. He enjoys playing indoor soccer and volleyball in his free time.

loans.use: Invest in planting corn and buying fertilizers

loans.name: Miguel Estuardo

texts.es:
Miguel Estuardo L. C. tiene 47 anos. Vive en union libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Rios. Tiene 2 hijos: Robinson de 12 anos y Robert de 2 anos. 

Miguel es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, frejol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total. 

Miguel se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz desde hace unos 20 anos que realiza labores agrícolas. Compra los insumos aquí en Ventanas y vende sus productos en la Parroquia de San Carlos. Solicita el credito para arrendar tierra para sembrar mas maíz, incrementando poco a poco sus cultivos. Su sueno es construir una casa. 

Le gusta jugar deportes, especialmente el volley.
texts.en: Miguel is 47 years old and lives with his common-law wife in Cantón de Ventanas, province of Los Rios. He has two children: Robinson, 12; and Robert, 2. Miguel is a member of the Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) community bank, which is located 25 kilometers from Cantón de Ventanas. The group makes a living working on short-cycle crops (corn, rice, soy, beans and cocoa), and there are 14 members overall. Miguel makes a living harvesting corn and rice, and has worked in agriculture for the past 20. He buys supplies in Ventanas and sells his products in the parish of San Carlos. He is requesting the loan so he can rent land to plant more corn, increasing his crops little by little. His dream is to build a home. He enjoys playing sports, especially volleyball.

loans.use: Purchase farming supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy children's and adults' clothing to sell

loans.name: Punta Del Este Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio Punta del Este, el mismo nombre del comite.

Las señoras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya, con este capital las señoras están aumentando sus pequeños negocios y así también sus ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.

Las señoras  están en el ciclo Nº  5º con sus 18 integrantes. 

La Sra. Olga quien forma parte de comite, posee una cantina, la misma es bastante concurrida, posee una buena clientela ya formada, brinda buena atención y calidad con sus productos, se dedica a la venta de comidas rápidas y así también almuerzos, a la vez bebidas, gaseosas, refrescos, ensaladas de frutas, etc.

Desea ampliar el negocio con mas variedad de comestibles, así como los dieteticos y vegetariano, además,teniendo en cuenta la llegada de la primavera deseea comercializar helados y más variadas bebidas.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from the Punta del Este neighborhood of the city of Tobati, which is 26 kilometers from the regional office in Caacupé.

These women are very satisfied with the economic support that Fundación Paraguaya offers them. With this capital, the women are expanding their small businesses and thus increasing their income for a better quality of life.

They are in their 5th loan cycle and have 18 members.

Sra. Olga, who is a member of the group, has a restaurant that is quite busy. She already has a well-established clientele. She offers good service and quality products. She sells fast food and also lunches, soft drinks and other beverages, fruit salads, etc.

She wants to expand her business with more varieties of food, such as dietetic and vegetarian; in addition, with the coming of spring, she wants to sell ice cream and a greater variety of beverages.

loans.use: Acquire products to prepare foods such as meats, bread, vegetables, condiments, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man living with his mother and one sibling. He is from Lebanon. After the death of his father, he found himself responsible for his family, so despite his young age, he started working as a mechanic five years ago. In 2007, this hard worker opened his own car repair shop to have his own business and own income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his business and purchase more mechanic tools to be able to receive more customers. He is optimistic about his business development and he hopes that the coming year will continue to bring positive growth.

loans.use: To improve his business and purchase more mechanic tools

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos M. B. tiene 32 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos. 

Juan es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, frejol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.
A Juan se dedica a la siembra de maíz y fréjol desde 20 anos. Las compras y ventas de sus productos realizan en el Cantón de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para arrendar tierras para sembrar maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito podría aumentar sus cultivos y arrendar más tierra. Su sueno es comprar un carro. Se desafía por encontrar tierra para arrendar y poder sembrar sus cultivos.
 
Le gusta jugar el indor fútbol y volley.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos M. B. is 32 years old. He has a common law marriage and lives in the village of Ventanas in the Los Rios Province. He has 4 children. 

Juan is a member of the Nueva Esperanza Rural Bank, which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas. It is a farming community based on growing corn, rice, soy beans, beans, and cacao. There is a total of 14 bank members.

He will use the loan money to rent land to plant corn. With the loan he will be able to increase the quantity of crops he grows and be able to rent more land. His dream is buy a car. The biggest challenges he faces are finding land to rent and planting his crops. 

He like to play indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: Rent more land and plant more crops

loans.name: Tindolo

texts.en:
Tindolo J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  

Tindolo is 45 years old and widowed. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house in the future.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice C. is a 32-year-old married lady who has four children. She operates a retail shop in the Midodoni area situated in Malindi. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of the existing clients of KADET. She is now taking her second loan, which amounts to 35,000 Kenyan shillings. She plans to expand her business with it by buying more stock and by repairing the business premises. 

Loice hopes that, by doing this, her business will grow and she will be able to use the anticipated profit to help support her family as well as being able to own a flourishing supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock for the shop and repair the business premises

loans.name: Segundo Flavio

texts.es:
Segundo Flavio L. C. tiene 38 anos. Es soltero y vive con sus hermanos en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Segundo es un socio de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Segundo se dedica al cultivo de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos para sembrar su maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría mejorar su vida. Se desafía por las plagas en sus cultivos. 
Le gusta salir a las fiestas en su tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Segundo Flavio L. C. is 38 years old. He is single, and he lives with his brothers in the town of Ventanas in the Los Rios Province.

Segundo is a member of the Nueva Esperanze Rural Bank, which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas. It is a farming community dedicated to growing corn, rice, soybeans, beans, and cacao. There are 14 members of the rural bank.

Segundo works growing corn and rice. He applied for the loan for funds to buy the supplies he needs to plant corn and rice. With the support from the loan he will be able to improve his life. His biggest challenge is insect infestation of his crops. 

He enjoys going out to parties in his free time.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies to plant corn and rice

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a married woman from Jenin. She has two sons and three daughters. The family owns a small poultry farm. Abeer took a $1,000 loan to pay for her husband's insurance and license renewal for the car which is used to transport chickens to vendors.

Abeer's kids are between eight and 17 and she hopes that the farm returns will be enough to cover their future university education expenses.

Abeer appears in FATEN's office in Jenin.

loans.use: To pay transportation costs for the family poultry business

loans.name: Gladys Murunga

texts.en:
Gladys Murunga M. is 42 years old. She is married to Daniel Katembe, who is a farmer. This also is a source of additional income for the family. They have three children, aged 20, 16 and 14 years old, respectively. Their residential place is in Eldoret-Kenya. 

She sells cereals and has been in this business for the past three years with a monthly profit of 10,000 Kenyan shillings.

Gladys learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area. She is applying for her second loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings from KADET LTD, with which she intends to buy 10 bags of ground nuts. With the anticipated profits, she plans to purchase her own plot of land.

In the future, Gladys wishes to expand her business and also to have a dairy farm. Her deeper desire is to see her children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy 10 bags of groundnuts

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora X. is forty years old and is married with a husband who is a builder. She has six children, three of whom go to school.

Flora is currently in the business of selling onions and is requesting a loan for more onions to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

loans.use: Buy more onions to sell

loans.name: Marcela Yolanda

texts.es:
Marcela Yolanda A. G. tiene 31 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. 

 Marcela  es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Marcela se dedica a la siembra de maíz desde hace 14 anos. Las compras y las ventas de sus productos realizan en el Cantón de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la siembra de maíz, comprando los insumos y abonos necesarios. Su sueno es tener un terreo propio y que sus hijos terminen sus estudios. Se desafía porque no alcanza el dinero para cubrir todas sus necesidades básicas. 

Le gusta ver televisión especialmente las noticias.
texts.en:
Marcela Yolanda A. G. is 31 years old. She has a common law marriage and lives in Ventanas in the Los Rios Province.

Marcela is a member of the Nueve Esperanza Rural Bank, which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas. It is a farming community dedicated to the growing of corn, rice, soybeans, beans, and cacao. There are 14 members of the bank.

Marcela has been growing corn for 14 years. She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas. She will use the loan to invest in the supplies and fertilizers she needs to plant corn. Her dream is to own her own land and that her children complete their studies. The biggest challenge she faces is that her income does not cover all of her family's basic needs.

In her free time she likes to watch television, especially news programs.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies and fertilizers necessary to plant corn

loans.name: Beatrice Indoshi

texts.en:
Beatrice Indoshi M. is 37-years-old, married and a mother of four children aged between fifteen and eight years. She is a businesswoman who sells secondhand clothes on a busy street in Narok town. She has been in business for the last five years. Beatrice believes she is a hardworking woman who only needs the resources to attain her goals.

Beatrice learned about KADET from other women who are already registered as clients. This will be her fifth loan. She is planning to buy more clothes to sell.

With her profits Beatrice hopes to rent a permanent shop from which she can sell her clothes. She plans to open another shop and so create employment for other people. Her future dream is to build her own house and run her shop from her own premises.

loans.use: To buy more second hand cloths for resale

loans.name: Jose Omar

texts.es:
José tiene 24 años, reside en San Francisco Gotera, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, él es soltero y vive con su padres, este negocio lo tiene desde hace dos años y fue iniciativa propia, la venta normalmente la realiza de las 6:00am a 1:00 pm los clientes llegan a su casa a comprar los pollos.
Él Solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de mas pollos y concentrado para su crianza y engordarlos para comercializarlos, este préstamo le será muy útil porque los meses que vienen se incrementa la demanda, por lo que ve necesario en este momento de crecer la granja para dar abasto a los clientes cuando estos se acerquen a comprar.
Su objetivo es aumentar en este momento la granja y que sus ventas sean buenas en los meses próximos beneficiándose con mayores ingresos, además quiere contar con el servicio a domicilio para negocios del centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
José is 24 years old and lives in San Francisco Gotera. He works raising chickens to sell for meat. He is single and lives with his parents. He started this business two years ago on his own initiative. He normally sells his birds from 6:00 AM to 1:00 pm; clients come to his house to purchase the chickens. 

He will use the loan money to purchase more chickens and concentrated feed to fatten them in order to sell them. This loan will be very useful because in the coming months demand increases, which is why now is the time to expand the farm so that he can provide his clients with sufficient product. 

His goal at the moment is to expand his farm and have good sales in the coming months resulting in increased profits. He also hopes to begin offering home delivery service to provide service to businesses in the city.

loans.use: Purchase of chickens and concetrate

loans.name: Kayembe

texts.en:
Originally from the Congo, Kayembe has been living in the United States for over 10 years. While he works at a car wash for steady income, he also has a successful business importing and selling handmade African masks and statutes from the Congo and other areas of central Africa. He has several booths at weekend flea markets in New York and the surrounding area. 

This is Kayembe’s ninth loan with ACCION USA. His previous loans have helped him to expand to his business beyond his own booth. He currently sells his product to other sellers and has his art featured in several other booths. With his current loan, he hopes to continue to expand his products by importing more artwork from Africa and continue his weekly booths at local flea markets. 

Ultimately, Kayembe hopes to expand his business into a storefront within the next year.  This will improve not only his local community but also help support the central African community.

loans.use: To purchase more art pieces from central Africa

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó mediante la unión de amigas y vecinas de San Antonio ya que se enteraron de Programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras y decidieron ayudarse para recibir los beneficios.
Actualmente se encuentran trabajando cada en sus actividades de manera independiente para los ingresos de sus familias, sin embargo no dejan de realizar algunas actividades en conjunto para recaudar fondos y de esta manera cuentan con ahorros y también les ayuda a pagar las cuotas de sus créditos.

La Sra. Librada Y. quien integrante y presidenta del comite, trabaja elaborando y vendiendo comestibles en un puesto de venta el cual es muy concurrido por la clientela teniendo en cuenta la ubicación, buena atención y calidad de productos.
 Ella desea invertir y ampliar el negocio mediante la adquisición al por mayor de más variedad de bebidas, como jugos en envases, gaseosas de más variedades, etc. y productos para la elaboración de las comidas como: panificados, lácteos, embutidos, carnes, verduras y frutas para diferentes ensaladas y jugos
 De esta manera estaría incrementando sus ingresos con las ventas, abaratando costos de producción.
texts.en:
This group was founded when friends and neighbors in San Antonio united, joined the program of the Committee of Entrepreneurial Women and decided to help one another to receive the benefits of the program. Each of them is currently working independently in her own business to earn an income and provide for her family, and yet they share a few activities to raise some funds and have some savings. This also helps to pay the installments of their loans.

Ms Librada Y., the member who chairs the group, prepares and sells meals in her stall, which is very popular because of its location, the good service and the quality of the food. She wants to invest in her business and expand it by purchasing in bulk a large quantity of drinks (juice in containers, several kinds of soft drinks, etc.) and ingredients for her dishes (bread, dairy products, sausages, meat, vegetables for salads and fruits for juices). Thus she would increase her income with higher sales and lower production costs.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, bread, condiments, drinks and fruit

loans.name: Rosa Antonia

texts.es:
Rosa Antonia V. S. tiene 32 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 6 hijos de 13 hasta 5 anos.
 
Rosa es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Rosa trabaja en la agricultura, sembrando maíz hace 10 anos. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos aquí en el Cantón de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para invertir en los insumos de maíz, por ejemplo fertilizantes, semillas, y herbicidas. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría aumentar sus cultivos de maíz. Su sueno es comprar un carro.
 
En el poco tiempo libre que tiene, se dedica a hacer quehaceres domesticas.
texts.en:
Rosa Antonia V. S. is 32 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage in Canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos province. She has 6 children from 13 to 5 years old.
 
Rosa is a member of the Nueva Esperanza (New Hope) rural loan program, which is located 25 kilometers from the Cantón of Ventanas. It is a community dedicated to short cycle work (sowing corn, rice, soy beans, broad beans, and cocoa beans. There are 14 members in total.

Rosa works in farming, sowing corn for 10 years. She purchases and sells her products here in the Canton of Ventanas. She is asking for the loan to invest in supplies for corn, for example fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides. With the help of the loan she will be able to increase her corn crops. Her dream is to buy a cart.
 
In the little free time that she has, she does her household chores.

loans.use: To invest in supplies for corn, for example fertilizers, seeds, and herbicides

loans.name: Teresia Wathira

texts.en:
Teresia Wathira N. is 31 years old, married to Daniel and a mother of two children, one nine years old and the other, one year old. She has a retail shop that she has been running for the last six years on a busy street in Narok town. Teresia believes she is a hardworking woman who only needs the resources to attain her goals.

Teresia learned about KADET from other women who are already registered clients. She would like to borrow 80,000 KES, which would be her fifth loan with KADET. She is planning to increase her shop stock by buying more kitchen items and toys for children.

With her profits from the proceeds of this loan, she plans to expand her business so as also to sell wholesale. Her dream is that she will be able to build her own house and run her shop from her own premises.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop

loans.name: Neri

texts.es:
Don Neri tiene 41 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 14 y 10 años de edad, residen en el municipio de Chinameca, departamento de San Miguel, su negocio es la venta de minutas de forma ambulante por las calles, parque y escuela de la ciudad, lo aprendió solo observando como los demás lo hacían, y lleva ya 10 años en esta actividad.
Don Neri quiere invertir en su negocio y para esto solicita un préstamo ya que comprara jaleas, colorantes, azúcar, vasos, cucharas y hielo, esta ayuda vendrá a superar este negocio y tener la oportunidad de recibir mayores ingresos para la sustencion de la familia; El deseo de él es conseguir con su trabajo la obtención de una refrigeradora para mantener en ella el hielo de las minutas, así como también ver a sus hijos desarrollados como profesionales con una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Neri is 41 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children,  who are 14 and 10 years old. They live in the municipality of Chinameca, in the department of San Miguel. His business is selling "minutas" [snow cones] as a mobile vendor on the streets and at the city park and school. He learned this business only by observing how the others did it, and he has done this work for 10 years now. 

Neri would like to invest in his business, and for that reason he is requesting a loan to buy syrups, colorings, sugar, cups, spoons and ice. This support will help his business advance, and he will have the opportunity to earn a better income to support his family. His desire is to earn enough through his work to buy a refrigerator so that he can store the ice for his snow cones. He would also like to see his children pursue a professional career and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buying syrup, sugar and ice to prepare "minutas" [snow cones]

loans.name: Patricia Lorena

texts.es:
Patricia Lorena B. G. tiene 27 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos de 10, 8 , 4, y 2 anos. 

Patricia es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Patricia se dedica a la agricultura. Siembra arroz, maíz, y fréjol desde hace 5 anos. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas. Solicita el credito para la siembra de maíz y arroz. Su sueno es tener un terreno propio y tener un negocio de tiendas. Se desafia por las plagas que comen a sus cultivos. 
No tiene mucho tiempo libre y se dedica a los quehaceres domesticos cuando tiene tiempo.
texts.en:
Patricia Lorena B. García, 27, lives in a common law marriage in Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  She has four children who are 10, 8, 4 and 2 years of age.

Patricia is a member of the “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas canton.  It is a community dedicated to short cycle crops (corn, rice, soya, broad beans and cacao).  It has 14 members.

Patricia is a farmer.  She has grown rice, corn and broad beans for the last five years.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.

She is asking for funds to plant corn and rice.  Her dream is to own her own land and to have a store.  Her challenge is pest infestations that destroy her crops.

She doesn’t have much free time but when she does she uses it to do her domestic chores.

loans.use: To plant corn and rice.

loans.name: Magdaline

texts.en: For five years, Magdaline, a 34-year-old mother of three, has been operating a retail shop with one employee.  She also runs a metal fabrication business to supplement her family's income.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Magdaline has learned how to run her business in a better way.  Hence, she has stabilized her business and can now afford access loans from Faulu Kenya.  Now requesting a loan of 55,000 Kes to buy steel rod for welding and sugar and rice for her shop, Magdaline hopes to open a supermarket in the future.

loans.use: To buy steel rod for welding and sugar and rice for her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn seed.

loans.name: Ytumi Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Compañía Ytumi de la ciudad de Caacupé son mujeres muy trabajadoras, y organizadas, realizan constantes actividades comerciales juntas, esto hace que el grupo sea cada vez más sólido y unido.
Las Señoras están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya,  porque gracias al crédito y a las constantes capacitaciones que reciben de la institución, aprendieron a ahorrar, a organizarse y de esa forma crear cada vez más fuentes de ingresos, que les ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
Las integrantes ya culminaron hoy su ciclo crediticio número 14, poseen una antigüedad de  5 a 6 años aproximadamente.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Rosa quien es comerciante, ella cuenta con una Buotique, donde ropas de buena calidad que ella misma trae de Brasil.
Viaja periódicamente para traer sus mercaderías del al Brasil, y nueva mente solicita el préstamo para otro viaje donde desea compra ropas para la temporada como vestidos, remeras, camisas, shorts, además quiere comprar zapatillas y calzados de varios tipos.
Comenta que la actividad le beneficia muchísimos  para  su marido quien también trabaja como empleado de una empresa de esta manera le brindan el mejor bienestar a sus 2 hijos.
texts.en:
The women of this communal bank live in the Ytumi neighborhood  in the city of Caacupé.  They are hard-working and organized women that do business together often.  This provides for a more solid and unified group.  The women are very grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the loans and the frequent training they receive from the institution.  They are learning to save, to organize themselves and thus, create more sources of income.  This has helped them to improve their quality of life and that of their families.  The members have been a part of the program for approximately 5-6 years and have just concluded their fourteenth loan cycle.  

One of the members is Señora Rosa, a business woman who owns a boutique.   She travels periodically to bring good quality clothing from Brazil to sell in her store.  She is requesting a loan to finance another trip so that a she can buy seasonal clothing like dresses, t-shirts, shirts, shorts and various types of shoes and footwear.  She says that this job is very beneficial for her husband who also travels as an employee of the business. This way they can offer their 2 children a better life.

loans.use: To purchase clothing like dresses, shirts, shoes and various types of footwear.

loans.name: Ntongai

texts.en:
Ntongai is 36 years old, married and blessed with two children. He is a hardworking and an ambitious man who runs a retail shop. He mainly sells cereals in his shop. He has been engaged in the business for four years. So far, he has managed to employ two people in his business.  

Ntongai also runs a motorbike transport business for extra income. He appreciates Faulu Kenya for helping him to start a retail shop. He hopes that someday, he will have three more outlets for his business. He has requested 60,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a posho mill to grind maize into corn flour.

loans.use: To buy a posho mill

loans.name: Meri Janed

texts.es:
Meri Janed R. Y. tiene 38 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos: Roxana (18), Taffarel (9), Fatima (5), y Scarlet (2). 

Meri es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Meri se dedica al cultivo de maíz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el Cantón de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para trabajar en la agricultura, comprando los insumos y abonos para sembrar maíz. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría mejorar su situación económica. Se desafía por las plagas que comen su maíz. 

En su tiempo libre le gusta pasar con su familia.
texts.en:
Meri Janed R. Y. is 38 years old.  She lives in a common-law partnership in the town of Ventanas, located in the province of Los Ríos.  She has 4 children: Roxana (18), Taffarel (9), Fatima (5), y Scarlet (2).

Meri is a member of the Nueva Esperanza (“New Hope”) rural cooperative, which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas.  It is a community dedicated to short cycle crops (corn, rice, soy beans, broad beans and cacao).  There are a total of 14 members.

Meri dedicates herself to planting corn.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.  She is requesting a loan to work in farming, buying supplies and fertilizers to plant corn.  With the support of the loan, she would be able to improve her financial situation.  She is challenged by the insect plagues that eat her corn.

She enjoys spending her free time with her family.

loans.use: To work in farming, buying the supplies and fertilizers necessary for planting corn.

loans.name: Vicuñitas Group

texts.es:
La Asociación  Comunal “VICUÑITAS” es una asociación que está solicitando crédito por primera vez, en el Centro Focal de Collpani.  Está compuesta por diez integrantes.  Las señoras  se reunirán cada quince días, para capacitarse  y pagar sus cuotas, permitiéndoles  conocerse mejor.   La mesa directiva está compuesta por la señora  Maura como presidenta, la señora Maria como tesorera y como secretaria de actas la señora Griselda.

La señora  Maura es una mujer de 27 años de edad, como presidenta de su asociación tiene la tarea de controlar que las integrantes de la mesa directiva y los grupos solidarios cumplan con sus funciones de manera adecuada.   Ella ingresó a la asociación gracias a la invitación de una amiga.  Con respecto a su negocio, ella vende dulces de forma ambulante, repartiendo a las tiendas y puestos de  los colegios.  Inicio este negocio con un pequeño capital hace seis años, aprendió el negocio de unos familiares que tienen el mismo negocio.

Con respecto a los negocios  que llevan adelante el resto de integrantes de la asociación son variados: venta de conservas, costura de polar, artesanìa en mantas, salon de Belleza, venta de ropa usada, ventas de  mantas, artesanìa en yeso, venta de papas fritas y chicharrones, venta de dulces.
texts.en:
The “VICUÑITAS” cooperative group is an association located in downtown Collpani, and is requesting a loan for the first time.  It is comprised of ten members.  The women meet every fifteen days to train and pay their loan installments, which also allows them to get to know each other better.  The management board is made up of Maura, president, Maria, treasurer, and Griselda, who serves as the secretary.

Maura is 27 years old and, as president of the group, has the task of ensuring that the management board and independent groups are carrying out their functions properly.  She joined the association thanks to a friend’s invitation.  With respect to her business, she works as a street vendor selling candy, distributing her products to stores and schools.  She started her enterprise six years ago with a small amount of capital, having learned the trade from a relative who has the same type of business.

With respect to the other members’ businesses, they are varied:  selling preserves, sewing pullovers, handcrafting blankets, a beauty parlor, selling used clothing, selling blankets, plaster handicrafts, selling French fries and chicharrones, and candy sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise (candies).

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace, 26 years old and single, is a member of Funga Leso Group under Faulu Kenya.  Through the group, she has learned how to save her money for future use.  For a living, Grace runs a cereal shop with one employee but hopes to expand her business in the future and open a retail shop.  She is now requesting 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy onions, tomatoes and fruits for her enterprise.

loans.use: To buy onions, tomatoes and fruits

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es:
Maria Morgon tiene 53 anos. Vive en unión libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo (Wilmer) de 13 anos. 

Maria es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Maria se dedica al cultivo de maíz. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos para sembrar maíz. Su sueno es hacer una casa. Se desafía por las plagas.
 
En su tiempo libre hace quehaceres domesticas.
texts.en:
Maria Morgon is 53 years old. She has a live-in partner and resides in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. She has one son (Wilmer), who is 13. 

Maria is a member of the Nueva Esperanza ["New Hope"] solidarity group, which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. It is a community which is dedicated to short-cycle farming (planting corn, rice, soy, beans and cacao). There are a total of 14 members. 

Maria's work is growing corn. She makes her purchases and sells her products in Ventanas. She is requesting the loan to buy supplies to plant corn. Her dream is to build a house. Her challenge is the pests [affecting her crops]. 
 
In her free time, she takes care of domestic chores.

loans.use: Buying supplies to plant corn

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 32-year-old carpenter.  He works together with five employees in his business.  He is a member of Neema group in Faulu Kenya whose members guarantee each other's loans.  Since he joined the group, he has become more focused in his business.  In five years, he hopes to open other outlets for his business.  He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy timber.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet is a 38-year-old married lady with three children who are in school.  She does stone quarrying to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 10 years and has managed to employ two people.  She hopes to expand her business and supply more stones.  She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stones.

loans.use: To buy stones

loans.name: Rene Arnulfo

texts.es:
Rene Arnulfo G. D. tiene 41 anos. Vive en union libre en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 5 hijos: Luis (15), Mayra (13), Bryan (11), Lety (9), y Jefferson (7). 

Rene es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Rene se dedica a la agricultura. Cultiva maíz, arroz, y frejol. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en Ventanas. Solicita el credito para la siembra de maíz. Con el apoyo del préstamo poco a poco se va incrementando su negocio. 

Le gusta jugar el fútbol y el boli.
texts.en:
Rene Arnulfo G. D. is 41 years old. He lives with his common-law wife in the canton of Ventanas, in Los Ríos province. He has 5 children: Luis (15), Mayra (13), Bryan (11), Lety (9), and Jefferson (7). 

Rene is a member of the Nueva Esperanza ["New Hope"] rural solidarity group, located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. It is a community dedicated to short-cycle farming, planting corn, rice, soy, beans and cacao. There are a total of 14 members. 

Rene's work is farming. He grows corn, rice and beans. He makes his purchases and sells his products in Ventanas. He is requesting the loan to plant corn. With the help of the loan, little by little he will expand his business. 

He enjoys playing soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: Planting corn

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en: Raphael is 53 years old and a father of four.  Besides being a farmer, he provides computer services such as photocopying for a fee. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has developed an open mind for business.  He hopes to have a fully established cyber café in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a photocopier and USB device.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier and USB

loans.name: Johanna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Johanna Elizabeth Gavilanes C. tiene 22 anos. Vive con sus papas en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hija, Katerine, de 7 anos. 

Johanna es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Johanna se dedica a la siembra de maíz desde 2 anos y tambien tiene una pequena tienda general. Hace las compras y las ventas de sus productos en el Cantón de Ventanas cada semana. 

Solicita el crédito para comprar los insumos (urea, herbicidas) para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría comprar mas cosas para su tienda y obtener mas ingresos económicos. Su sueno es ser ingeniera de sistemas. Dice que a veces no se alcanza el tiempo en la vida. 
Le gusta salir todos los días a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Johanna Elizabeth Gavilanes C. is 22 years old.  She lives with her parents in Ventanas Canton in Los Rios province.  She has a seven-year-old daughter named Katrine.  

Johanna is a member of the Nueva Esperanza rural ventanilla (rural loan program) which is located 25 kilometers from Ventanas Canton.  Inhabitants of the community make their living as short-cycle workers, planting corn, rice, soybeans, beans, and cacao.  There are 14 members in all.

Johanna has been planting corn for two years and also has a small general store. She buys and sells her products in Ventanas Canton each week.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies (urea fertilizer, herbicides) for corn cultivation.  With the loan, she will be able to buy more merchandise for her store and earn more income. Her dream is to become a systems engineer.  She says that sometimes there are not enough hours in the day, She enjoys daily visits to the city.

loans.use: To plant corn.

loans.name: Neris Jacinta

texts.es:
Neris Jacinta S. A. tiene 24 anos. ES soltera y vive con sus padres en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos.
 
Neris es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Neris se dedica a la siembra de maíz y arroz, y es profesora en un colegio particular hace 2 anos. Compra sus productos en el cantón de Ventanas en época de invierno. Solicita el crédito para invertir los abonos para sembrar arroz. Con la ayuda del préstamo, poco a poco podría obtener mas ingresos económicos porque realizaría un buen negocio con sus cultivos. Su sueno es comprar una casa. Su trabajo en la agricultura es difícil porque las plagas comen sus cultivos de arroz, uno que se llama ¨langosta¨ especificamente. 

Trabaja todos los días a la semana.
texts.en:
Neris is 24 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the canton of Ventanas in the Los Ríos province.
Neris is a member of the community bank "New Hope", which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas. The people from this community do cyclical agricultural work (sowing corn, rice, soy, beans, and cocoa.) There are 14 members in total.
Neris grows corn and rice, and has been a teacher at a private school for 2 years. She buys her products in the canton of Ventanas during the winter. She is requesting a loan to invest in fertilizer for sowing rice. With the help of the loan, little by little she will be able to get more income because she does good business with her crops. Her dream is to buy a house. Her farming work is difficult because pests eat her rice crops, particularly a type of locust.
She works every day of the week.

loans.use: To invest in fertilizers for planting rice

loans.name: Gladis Hermelinda

texts.es:
Gladis C. E. tiene 44 anos. Es casada y vive en el cantón de Ventanas en la  Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos de 25, 24, 22, y 11 anos. 

Gladis es socia de la ventanilla rural Nueva Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica a labores de ciclo corto (siembra de maíz, arroz, soya, fréjol, y cacao. Son 14 socios en total.

Gladis se dedica a la venta de medicina natural y a la siembra de maíz. Compra sus productos en Guayaquil y vende en lugares distintos. Solicita el crédito para comprar más cosas que vender en su negocio de venta de medicina. Con el apoyo del préstamo podría aumentar el capital y comprar más productos, obteniendo mas ingreso económico. Su sueno es tener una casa y poner un centro de venta de su negocio de medicina. A veces se desafía por la competencia sobre la venta de su negocio y la falta de capital para comprar mas medicinas. 

Trabaja todos los días a la semana y no tiene mucho tiempo libre.
texts.en:
Gladis C. E. is 44 years old, married, and lives in the canton of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  She has four children, who are 25, 24, 22, and 11 years old.

Gladis is a member of the rural group Nueva Esperanza [New Hope], which is located 25 kilometers from the canton of Ventanas.  It is a community dedicated to short-cycle workers who grow corn, rice, soy, beans, and cocoa.  There are 14 members in total.

Gladis works selling natural medicines and growing corn.  She buys her products in Guayaquil and sells them in other places.  She is asking for this loan to purchase more things to sell in her store that sells medicine.  With the support of the loan, she can increase her capital and purchase more products, so she can earn more income.  

Her dream is to have a house and a store for her medicine business.  Sometimes she is challenged by her business and her lack of capital to buy more medicines.

She works every day of the week and doesn't have a lot of free time.

loans.use: Purchase more things to sell in her medicine store

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a 56-year-old businessman. He raises chicken for eggs and meat. He has been in this business for two years and describes his environment as good. He has a good customer base and he raises cows for additional income. A hardworking father of three, Robert hopes to continue expanding his business to the level of selling chicken and eggs at wholesale. He has requested a loan of Kes. 60,000 to build an additional shed and purchase 150 chicks. Robert is a member of Ngong Vision SHG.

loans.use: To build an additional shed and purchase 150 chicks

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda P. is a married woman who lives in Lower Calasa, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:  Sugarcane plantation, rice field and fish selling businesses.  Her husband Simeon P., who is 34 years old, works as a Laborer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 7 to 20 years old. 

Melinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 10 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 11th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000 which she intends to use as additional capital in her fish vending and to purchase fertilizer for her farm so that she could continue to save up for future house repairs and her children's education. 

Melinda P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the Operations of a sugarcane plantation

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga pertenece al Banco Comunal Arrieros, es soltera, tiene 50 años D. edad, tiene 2 hijos. Olga se dedica a L. comercialización  D. granos, estos los adquiere en el Mercado Mayorista Nery G. Zarate, cuenta con un puesto propio  en el mercado playa Grau en Ayacucho y tres puestos en el Mercado mayorista Santo Domingo en Ica.
Olga solicita un préstamo que será destinado a L. compra D. granos.
DesD. que está en FINCA su negocio ha mejorado pues aprendió en las capacitaciones a ser  puntual, responsable.
Su sueño en su negocio es comprar un carro y poder desplazarse D. Ayacucho a Ica llevando sus granos y lo familiar es adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en:
Olga belongs to the Arrieros ["Carriers"] communal bank. She is 50 years old and single, with 2 children. Olga's work is selling grains. She buys them at the "Nery G. Zarate" wholesale market. She has her own stand in the market on Grau plaza in Ayacucho, and three stands in the Santo Domingo wholesale market in Ica.

Olga is requesting a loan which she will use to buy grains.

Since she has been with FINCA, her business has improved, since she has learned from the training to be punctual and responsible. 

Her dream for her business is to buy a car so that she can travel between Ayacucho and Ica, transporting her grains, and her dream for her family is to acquire her own house.

loans.use: Buying grains

loans.name: Rozel

texts.en:
Rozel Z. is a 28-year old married who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures:   Raising pigs , tricycle transport and food vending businesses.  She lives in Prk. Orchids, Brgy. Talacagay, Hinobaan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard at raising pigs , tricycle transport and food vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 4000. 

Rozel is now borrowing PHP 12000 so that she  could  fund the operation of raising her pigs.  This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Rozel aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Operating funds for raising pigs

loans.name: Geoconda Elizabeth

texts.es:
Geoconda Elizabeth C. S. tiene 20 anos. En Unión Libre vive con el compañero y un hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo, Odalys, de 3 años.
  
Geoconda es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Geoconda trabaja en el comercio de venta de ropa, sabanas toallas por pedidos, realiza las comprar en Guayaquil en las vende en un local de su casa.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es ponerse un  local y comprar una casa.
En su tiempo libre le gusta jugar el indor fútbol y el volley.
texts.en:
Geoconda Elizabeth C. S. is 20 years old. She lives in a common law relationship with her partner and has one child.  She lives in the canton of Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  Her child, Odalys, is three years old.

Geoconda is a member of the La Esperanza (Hope) rural bank, located 25 miles from Ventanas Canton.  This is a community primarily devoted to commerce.  The group meets each month in the neighborhood of San Vicente.

Geoconda works in the business of selling clothing, sheets and towels ordered by her customers.  She purchases them in Guayaquil and sells them at her home.

She is applying for the loan to purchase merchandise in order to enlarge her business.  The loan would help her acquire her necessities by supporting her financially.  Her dreams are to have a shop and buy a house.  

In her spare time she likes to play indoor soccer and volleyball.

loans.use: To enlarge her business.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas pertenece al Banco Comunal Arrieros, es casada, tiene 57 años, tiene 8 hijos. Felicitas no sabe leer ni escribir, se dedica a la comercialización  D. quesos que los adquiere en el Puente Nuevo y los venD. en la puerta del Cine Cavero con la ayuda D. sus hijos, también se dedica a la compra D. cereales, viaja a las chacras ahí los compra luego lo distribuye en los mercados D. Playa Grau y Nery García Zarate.
Felicitas solicita un préstamo para la compra D. granos y quesos, le gusta Finca por sus capacitaciones porque a aprendido trabajar y ahorrar.
texts.en:
Felicitas belongs to the community bank "Arrieros". She is married, 57 years old, and has 8 children. Felicitas cannot read or write. She works selling cheese that she gets from Puente Nuevo and sells at the door of Cine Cavero. Her children help with this work. She also buys cereals from the farms in the area and sells them in the markets of Playa Grau and Nery García Zarate.
Felicitas is requesting a loan to buy cereals and cheese. She likes Finca because of the training they offer as she has learned to work and save.

loans.use: To buy grain and cheese

loans.name: Aura Rosa

texts.es: Aura Rosa, habitante de  Nva Guinea,  es una mujer muy trabajadora y progresiva, su familia esta conformada por su esposo y 1 hijo de 18 meses de edad, su esposo trabaja como conductor de camion recibiendo ingresos mensuales que constribuyen al bienestar del hogar y de la familia; Aura tiene establecido su pequeño negocio de pulperia el que es su principal actividad economica, esta solicitando su primer credito para imcrementar el inventario de su pulperia y diversificar los tipos de productos ofertados, de manera que pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y que su negocio sea mas rentable y asi poder tener oportunidades de crecer a nivel economico, espera ser beneficiada con el fondo KIVA para poder hacer realidad su sueño, en su comunidad la consideran como, una persona responsable y trabajadora.
texts.en: Aura Rosa lives in Nva Guinea. She is a hardworking, progressive woman. Her family consists of her husband and an 18 month old son. Her husband works as a truck driver and receives a monthly salary which contributes to the well being of the family and the home. Aura has started a small grocery business which is her primary economic activity. She is requesting her first loan to increase her inventory and diversify the types of products that she offers so that she can offer a better service to her customers and make her business more profitable. In this way, she will have opportunities to increase her economic standing. She hopes to receive the KIVA loan so that she can realize her dream. In her community, she is considered to be a responsible and hardworking person.

loans.use: To buy goods for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn P. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Malinawun, Brgy. Mabini, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a business venture: Mango and Banana plantation business.  Her husband Diosdado, who is 53 years old, works as a Farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are 23 to 29 years old. 

Evelyn joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1996 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19,500 which she intends to use to buy pesticides and equipment for her mango plantation so that she could continue to save up for future home repairs and the expansion of her business. Evelyn P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Fund the operations of her Mango and Banana plantation

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is 32 years old and single.  She sells second-hand shoes and clothes to earn a living.  She also does farming to earn extra income.  She hopes to succeed in her business and build her own house in the future.  

Since Everlyn joined Faulu Kenya, she has learned business techniques which have helped her in running her business.  She sees herself opening more outlets for selling second-hand clothes in the future.  She has requested for 20, 000 Kes to buy shoes and ladies handbags.

loans.use: To buy shoes and ladies handbags

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia T. is a married woman who lives in Hda. Amparo, Brgy. Mabini, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  tailoring and livestock businesses. Her husband Jerry, who is 44 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 9 to 22 years old.

 Letecia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Letecia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 9th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use to buy raw materials for her tailoring business so that she could continue to save up for the future of her children's education and expansion of her business. 

Letecia T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for her tailoring business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
"Shirly S. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Kalubihan, Brgy. Libertad, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  General Store and Livestock businesses. Her husband Glicerio, who is 64 years old, is a retired employee who helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 9 children who are 22 to 30 years old. 

Shirly joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Shirly has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 3,500, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 8th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to  purchase more stocks for her general store so that she could continue to save up for the education of her grandchildren and expansion of her business. 

Shirly S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF: 
 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase more stocks of goods to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 32 years old, married and a father of three.  To raise his family, he sells clothes. He started the business 10 years ago and Faulu Kenya has helped him to expand.  He has even managed to employ one person. He hopes to buy a plot of land in the future.  He has requested for 20, 000 Kenyan shillings to buy supplies of clothes.

loans.use: To buy supplies of clothes

loans.name: Esther Deysi

texts.es:
Esther Deysi L. B. tiene 45 anos. Es casado vive con el compañero y un hijo, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. Tiene 1 hijo.

Esther es una socia de la ventanilla rural La Esperanza, que está ubicada a 25 kilometres del Cantón de Ventanas. Es una comunidad que se dedica al comercio en mayoría este grupo se reúne cada mes en el sector del barrio San Vicente.

Esther trabaja en el Colegio Humberto y tiene una tienda donde vende helados y trabaja con el esposo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de mercadería para ampliar su negocio. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Su sueno es ponerse un  local y comprar una casa.

Le gusta caminar con la familia.
texts.en:
Esther Deysi L. B. is 45 years old.  She is married, and lives with her partner and a son in the town of Ventanas, located in the Los Ríos province.  She has 1 son.

Esther is a member of the La Esperanza (“Hope”) cooperative, located 25 kilometers from the town of Ventanas.  This is a community that is primarily dedicated to commerce.  The group meets every month in the San Vicente neighborhood.
